loans.name: Grupo Solidoario El Cerro Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Bilma tiene 33 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y honrada, junto con ella vive sus dos hijos los cuales le ayudan en su actividad, ella vive en una aldea de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras, su negocio se encuentra en un punto muy estratégico donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades, ya que viene trabajando con ellos dese hace 5 años.
Doña Bilma el crédito lo necesita para la  compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, embutidos, azúcar, refrescos, lácteos y pollo, de esta manera ella piensa satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus cliente los cuales desde muy temprano visitan su negocio.
Doña Bilma tendrá un impacto con el financiamiento que  podrá abastecer mas su negocio, y así  contrarrestar la demanda de producto que le hacen a diario, como también generarse mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Doña Bilma tiene sus planes a futuro que son hacer crecer su negocio y mandar sus hijos a la universidad.
Estanislao se dedica a su pulpería y servicio de molino a tiempo completo.
Gelmy su negocio es la venta de tortillas todos los días.
Xiomara ella vende tortillas y tamalitos pisques.
Brenda su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Bilma is a hard-working and honest 33 year old woman who lives with her two children who help her with her business in the town of Choluteca, in the southern Honduras.  Her business is in a very strategic location where there is a heavy flow of customers since she has been working with them for the last 5 years.  
Bilma needs this loan to purchase corn, beans, meat, sausage, sugar, sodas, dairy products and chicken in order to satisfy the needs of her customers who from very early in the morning begin to visit her place of business.  
Bilma will receive the financial benefit from being able to maintain the inventory of her business and in that way offsetting the daily demand for products, as well as generating better earnings to give a better quality of life to her family.  Bilma has plans for her future; she wants to make her business grow and send her children to college.  
Other group member Estanislao makes a living in his local grocery store and mill service working full time; another member Gelmy sells tortillas every day as his business; Xiomara also sells tortillas and tamales pisques (tamales stuffed with black beans) and Brenda sells new clothes to earn money.  

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, meat, sausage, sugar, sodas, dairy products and chicken for their business.

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Me, 51, is from Kampot province. She has been living there with her family: her husband and eight single children. Most of her children are students and depend on the income generated from cultivation of the land by her and her spouse. She also gets some help from her children. Rice is the common crop she prefers to grow twice a year. 

Now Me would like to apply for a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for business and home use. She hopes it will provide good transportation for the family to anywhere they wish without taking any taxi services as in the old time.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for business and home use.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak, 55, is from the village of Prey Chor in Kompong Cham province. She is married and has a daughter and a son. Her daughter now is working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. 

Kak has only a primary-school education and has been farming for many years. She commonly grows rice twice a year. She is lucky to have a supportive husband who always helps her manage the work at the field.

She is looking for a loan to purchase a cow and to pay for the process of dry-season rice cultivation. She expects this investment to increase the family income by 25 percent.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to pay for the process of dry-season rice cultivation.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Эльмире 27 лет, замужем, воспитывает дочку 3 лет. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, Эльмира   с 2005 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Эльмиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы, 3 теленка, 1 лошадь, что позволяет ей иметь 15,000 сом ежемесячной прибыли. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм и перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Эльмира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Elmira is 27 years old, married, and raising a three-year old daughter. In the search of a source of income for her family, since 2005 Elmira launched a livestock business, with a starting capital of 30,000 KGS. Thanks to Elmira’s hard work, her livestock currently includes three cows, three calves, and one horse, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of 15,000 KGS. 

In order to continue growing her business , Elmira turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS in order to buy bulls for fattening and resale. Elmira plans to use the revenues from her loan for a further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is photographed next to his taxi.
Jameel is a 45 year old man. He is married and a father of two sons. For the past 10 years, Jameel has been a taxi driver, which has been a profitable project.

Jameel is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi and making some repairs to his house, such as painting and changing the tiles. Taking this loan will allow Jameel to move from one place to another and work extra hours and take more customer requests.  This will increase the family's income.

loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing the taxi and making some repairs to his house

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is photographed in the home appliances store, next to the television he wants to purchase.
Basem is a 31 year-old young man. He is married and has no children yet. He is employed and gets a salary, but not enough to cover all life's costs and expenses.
Basem is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing a new television and new living room chairs for his house. This will create for Basem and his wife better and more comfortable home living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a television and living room chairs

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 47 years old and from the village of San Isidro province of Isabela. Angela is engaged in furniture making such as tables, chairs and beds made from wood. Angela is married with 5 grown children. She is a very responsible person and loving wife to Ricardo. Angela is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy wood and materials needed in her business. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: A very loving and responsible Ma. Theresa is a single mom who has one son. She is engaged in a retail store where she sells different products such as soy sauce, rice, vinegar and oil to the people of the community. Ma. Theresa is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy additional products that she can offer in the community such as canned goods, snack foods and drinks, in order to have more income so she can meet the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her retail business

loans.name: Grupo Brisas Los Arcos Group

texts.es:
La Señorita Merlín, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera, joven con visión emprendedora y futurista ya que a su temprana edad ha iniciado con su negocio y actualmente sigue cursando sus estudios secundarios y cuando anda en clases su madre le ayuda en la administración del negocio, ella reside en la casa de habitación de sus padres en Danli, El Paraiso.
Merlín, se dedica al comercio con una experiencia de 3 años de administración del mismo y su principal actividad es una pulpería misma que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “Ángel”. en su negocio se encuentra lo más necesario para el consumo diario como ser azúcar, arroz, manteca, café, pan, espaguetis, papel higiénico, etc.
Merlín solicita el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, arroz, manteca, pastas, maíz, refrescos y otros productos de uso diario, ella con este crédito tendrá un impacto en su negocio de aumento de producto y esto le traerá mas clientes para tener mejores ventas.
Merlín sueña con ayudar a sus padres para que toda la familia tenga una mejor vida y desea terminar sus estudios.
Don Leandro cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de maíz y frijoles.
Don Elvin, se dedica a la compra de reses destazadas y las vende en su carnicería.
Don José, se dedica a la compra de reses para el destazo también las vende en su carnicería.

Danlí, El Paraíso Honduras - Marzo de 2012
texts.en:
Merlín is an 18 year old young woman who is single and has an entrepreneuring vision and a forward-thinking perspective.  At her young age she has begun her own business and currently is finishing her high school education.  She lives in Danli, El Paraiso in her parents' home, and when she has to go to school for classes, her mother helps with the administration of the business.  

Merlín has 3 years of experience in the administration of this business, which is a local grocery store which goes by the name of "Pulpería Ángel".  In her business, the most sold items for daily consumption are beans, rice, butter, pastas, corn and other staple products, and with this loan Merlín will see the impact in an increase in product, which will bring her more customers and as a result, better sales numbers.  

Merlín dreams of helping her parents so that her whole family has a better life, as well as finishing her studies.  Other group member Don Leandro has 10 years of experience buying and selling corn and beans; Don Elvin and Don José make a living buying freshly butchered beef and selling it in their respective butcher shops.  

Danlí, El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, butter, pastas, corn, soda and other products for his business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a vendor selling fruits and vegetables in her village. This kind of business allows her to gain an income for the sustainability of her family. She is married to a farmer and has three children. As of now, she has insufficient funds to buy vegetables. She is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy eggplant, cabbage, pechay, camote and string beans. In the future, she hopes that her business will become more productive in terms of income so that she can lessen her family's current poor-living situation.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage, pechay, camote and string beans

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 56 years old, with 8 grown children. She has been engaged in furniture making for 8 years. She is very diligent and a kind person, not only in her family, but also in the community. Veronica is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy materials needed in her furniture business. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a businessman who repairs phones to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 50000 KES to buy spare phone parts.

loans.use: to buy spare phone parts.

loans.name: Hamidan Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hamidan bibi is a 49-year-old, married woman. By this relationship, she has two sons. 

Hamidan and her husband are both very hardworking people. They help each other manage the finances of the home. Hamidan sells vegetables while her husband works in the transportation business. 

Hamidan’s business is home-based. She sells vegetables in a cart near her home's front door. Her clients are community members who buy vegetables from her. She sells fresh vegetables at reasonable rates. Her clients prefer buying from her due to the excellent service she provides.  

Hamidan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her vegetable-sales business. With the loan investment, she will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.
 
She is very hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos, who is from Njambini, has a milk-selling business that he has been operating for the past five years. He is 31 years old and married to his wife, Mary.

Amos has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him add more liters of milk to his business. He is optimistic that his business will do well after he receives the loan.

Amos hopes to become the leading milk dealer in the area, enabling him to increase his income and eventually buy a pickup truck.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 53 years old and from the village of San Isidro province of Isabela. She has 4 adult children. Lydia has been engaged in furniture making such as beds, tables and chairs, for 20 years. Lydia is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy wood and other materials needed in her business. In the future, Lydia hopes that her business expands and she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: A very dedicated mother to her family, Pacita is 56 years old with three grown children. She lives in the village of San Isidro province of Isabela. Pacita manages a store where she sells different vegetables and fruits to the people in the community. Pacita is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and bananas to have additional income. She hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, tomatoes, eggplant and bananas for her business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 26 years old and married with two children. She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years.

Naomi describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. She describes her customers as low-income earners because they live in slums. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Naomi has been able to save money and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a 40,000 KES loan to buy potatoes, onions and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Petronillah

texts.en:
Petronillah is 38 years old and married. She is blessed with six children, ages 20,17,15,13, 9 and 4. She practices dairy farming, which she began doing three years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Petronillah has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase animal feed to enable more milk production. The anticipated profits will help her repay her loan as well as improve her animals’ productivity. This is her first loan.

Petronillah's dream is to own a big dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed for her cow to enable more milk production.

loans.name: Agata

texts.en:
Agata is 51 years old and married with four children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and has employed two people. Agata also does farming to earn extra income. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Agata has been able to educate her children. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 100,000 to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a 51 year-old widow blessed with three children. She practices dairy farming, which she started two years ago. She earns a monthly income of 12000 KES. 

She has requested a loan of 20000 KES to purchase a dairy cow for additional milk production. This is her first loan.

The anticipated profit will be used to venture into other forms of farming. Her dream is to own a big dairy farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia bibi is a 49 year-old married woman with three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons work in a factory while her daughter stays at home and does decorative embroidery work. She also manages the household work. Safia’s husband works in a factory, which provides a meager income.

Safia herself is also very supportive. Besides managing her household responsibilities, she also financially supports her family by operating a clothing business. She is an expert in her business and has been doing it for more than 10 years. She buys clothes from different places, which she sells to her customers to earn a profit. The profit she earns enables her to pay for utilities. 

Safia has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothing business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties in larger quantities to resell. She is very confident about expanding her business after a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Ana, tiene 36 años de edad, ella tiene una hija, Ana su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería desde hace más de 6 años, ella es madre soltera.
Ana solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico, maíz, frijoles y otros productos de consumo para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en un punto estratégico en su hogar, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo Ana, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y ayudarla a salir adelante con sus estudios, ella trabaja  muy duro para contar con el patrimonio familiar.
Ana tiene uno de sus sueños que es tener una de las mejores pulperías de la zona.
La Señora Ramona,  se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y platos de comida.
La Señora Blanca, se dedica a la venta de comida y golosina como tajaditas, baleadas, hot dog, pan con carne, ella tiene 4 años de experiencia en el mismo. 

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Ana is a 36 year old single mother of one daughter whose principal business activity is selling groceries, which she has been doing for the last 6 years.  Ana is requesting support in order to purchase products like sugar, butter, soap, sodas, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and other staple products which will help her achieve good customer service.  She has her business strategically located in her home, and the support of the requested loan will contribute to the improvement of Ana's business which will allow her to have better earnings.  This will cover household costs and give a better quality of life to her daughter and help her to get ahead with her studies; she works very hard to create a strong family legacy.  

One of Ana's dreams is to have one of the best grocery stores in the area.  Another member Ramona makes a living selling nacatamales (steamed corn cakes) and other dishes, while Blanca has been selling prepared food and candy such as "tajaditas" (sauteed bananas), "baleadas" (tortillas filled with beans), hot dogs, and breads with meat for the last 4 years.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase sugar, butter, soap, soda, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and other staples for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has two children. He lives with 11 family members; six of them work.

Ibrahim has owned a food market since 2011. He sells soft drinks, juices, groceries, dairy products, cheese, and frozen beef, chicken and fish. He has sufficient experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to install a sliding door, to buy an electric generator and to add more foodstuffs. He wants to earn a greater profit in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator, to add more foodstuffs and to install a sliding door.

loans.name: Gerardo Alfredo

texts.es:
Gerardo Alfredo, tiene 32 años de edad, está casado tiene dos hijos, vive en el sureste de san Pedro sula.
Hace 3 años que se dedica a realizar su propia actividad de negocio de elaborar y venta de  todo tipo de pan, pasteles y reposterías. El inicio en sociedad con un primo pero decidió  trabajar en forma independiente  y se motivo  porque el  local del negocio está bien ubicado y se vende el producto. El adquirió gran experiencia donde trabajaba. 
Esta solicitando su primer préstamo el cual  lo va invertir en la compra de una motocicleta que ocupa para distribuir productos de la panadería y como su medio de transporte.
Su sueño es expandir mas su negocio, hacer más clientes en las zonas que están a su alrededor.
texts.en:
Gerardo Alfredo, age 32, is married and has two children.  He lives in the southeastern part of San Pedro Sula.

For three years he has been devoting himself to his own business activity.  He makes and sells all types of bread, cakes, and pastries.  He started working with a cousin, but he decided to work independently.  He was motivated because his place of business is in a good location, and his product sells.  He has acquired a lot of experience where he worked.

He is requesting his first loan to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to deliver products from his bakery.  He will also use it as a means of transportation.  His dream is to expand his business and to get more customers from neighboring areas.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to sell pastries.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Don  Joaquín es una  persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente  vive  con  su  esposa  y  sus cuatro hijos, el vive con su familia en un caserío de namasigue en el departamento de  Choluteca.
Don Joaquín se  dedica  a su negocio de compra y venta  de  ganado  el  préstamo  lo necesita  para  la  compra  de reses.
Don Joaquín espera   que  al  finalizar  esta época de  verano  por  lo menos cinco reses sean vendidas. Y que el invierno sea mejor ya que es una  zona  muy  productiva  de mariscos, ganadería  y  otro tipo  de  actividades.
El deseo de Don Joaquín es seguir  trabajando  duro  para  a si   terminar  de  darle a sus hijos  la mejor educación y así  que  sean  personas  de  bien para la sociedad.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Joaquin is a very hard-working person who lives with his wife and their 4 children in a settlement called Namasigue in the department of Choluteca, Honduras. Joaquin's business is buying and selling cattle. Joaquin is requesting the loan to buy additional beef cattle.

Joaquin hopes to have sold at least 5 cattle by the end of summer. And he hopes to do better in the winter, since the region is very productive for shellfish, cattle, and other types of activities.

Joaquin wants to continue working hard in order to provide his children with the best education possible so they will become people who benefit society.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a 38 year-old married mother of two young children who don’t go to school. Her husband is a cobbler by profession; he makes shoes. He is very active and efficient in his work. His shoes are of very high quality, and his customers are very satisfied with his work. 

Jamila herself is involved in making parandas (an ornament used to tie back hair). She is very creative in her work. She makes beautiful parandas, including styles that are embroidered, colored or simple. Her product is in high demand among her clients. She does this work to help financially support her family.

Jamila has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her parandas business. With the loan, she will buy required material such as thread and beads in larger quantities for making parandas of better quality and in larger quantities.

She is hopeful that by having enough material she will be able to fulfill the orders of her clients and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy materials for a paranda making business.

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.ru: Хоимдджон реализует обувь на большом рынке города. Он торгует на рынке почти 8 лет. Хомиджон привозит сам свой товар с Киргизии. Он живет с родителями, женат имеет 1 ребенка, его жена домохозяйка. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. Раньше он торговал на местных городских рынках 2 раза в  неделю. Сейчас после получения кредита, он увеличил свой товарооборот и арендует контейнер на большом рынке.Kредит получает для  привоза весеннего товара.
texts.en: Homidjon sells shoes at a large city market.  He has been selling at the market for almost eight years.  Homidjon brings in his merchandise by himself from Kyrgyzstan.  He lives with his parents, is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been partnering with our organization since 2009.  Previously, he sold at local city markets twice per week.  Now, after obtaining a loan, he increased his goods turnover and leases a container at a big market.  Homidjon is requesting this loan to bring in spring merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Oscar Raul

texts.es:
Oscar Raúl, tiene 50 años de edad, está casado ya tiene tres hijos de 6, 16 y 21 años de edad, vive en San Pedro Sula, cortes.
El tiene muchos años de dedicarse al comercio, hace aproximadamente 20 años que estableció el negocio de venta de lentes, controles y cables para televisores, relojes y reparación de relojes. Este negocio lo tiene en el mercado de la ciudad, al que le dedica 9 horas diarias, todos los días, siendo este su fuente de ingresos para su familia. En el mercado le ayuda su esposa y el sale a vender a otros lugares. Toda la mercadería que vende es comprada en un país vecino.
Es su primer préstamo y lo invertirá en compra de mercadería  como ser anteojos, y controles para televisores, para mantener surtido el negocio.
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, para obtener más ganancias y poder comprar otra vivienda y poderle dar el estudio universitario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oscar Raúl, age 50, is married and has three children, ages 6, 16, and 21.  He lives in San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

He has been working in commerce for many years.  Approximately 20 years ago he established the business of selling glasses, controls and cables for televisions, watches and watch repair.  His business is at the city market.  

He works nine hours a day, every day because this is his source of income for his family.  His wife helps him at the market, and he leaves to sell at other places.  All of the merchandise he sells is purchased in a neighboring country.

This is his first loan.  He will use it to buy merchandise like glasses and television controls in order to keep his business stocked.  His goals are to make his business grow, to get more income, to be able to buy another house, and to be able to give his children a college education.

loans.use: to stock his business with merchandise like glasses and television controls.

loans.name: Parvana

texts.ru:
Parvana uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey raznix smeshannix tovarov (ruchki , tetradi, fanari, kley, krem dlya ruk i litca i t.d) v Regionax Azerbaydjana chasno bivayut takiye magazini so smeshannimi tovarami. Ona nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi uvelichit  magazin i kolichestvo polok dlya tovarov chtobi razvit svoy bizness. Parvana 37 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona i yeyo bolshaya semya jivut v Fuzuli regione, oni pereselenci iz Fuzuli goroda i yavlyayutsya IDP personami. 


 Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Parvana has been involved in selling various mixed goods (pens, notebooks, flashlights, glue, face and hand lotions, etc.) in Azerbaijan's regions.  Stores with mixed merchandise are common.  She needs 1600 AZN to expand her store and increase the quantity of shelves for merchandise in order to develop her business.  Parvana is 37 years old, married and has three children.  She and her large family live in the Fuzuli region.  They moved from the city of Fuzuli and are IDPs.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognized State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs)

loans.use: to expand her store and increase the quantity of shelves for merchandise

loans.name: Elgun

texts.ru:
Etot molodoy chelovek ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Elgun mama imeyet serdechnuyu bolezn, Elgun starayetsya mnogo rabotat i zarobativat chtobi on mog oplatit lecheniye svoyey materi. Elgun seychas nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi pochinit svoy taxi, tak kak on ne mojet rabotat poka yego taxi isporcheno i tem samim on ne uspevayet oplatit lecheniye svoyey materi. Elgun uje 3 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda.

Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
This young man is not married and does not have children.  He lives in the Fuzuli region together with his mother.  Elgun's mother has a cardiovascular disease.  Elgun tries to work hard and earn money so that he could help pay for his mother's medical treatment.  He currently needs 1600 AZN to repair his taxi because he cannot work until his taxi is fixed and cannot keep up with paying for his mother's treatment.  Elgun has been working as a taxi driver for three years.  He is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person who have been forced or obliged to flee his home, in particular as a result of an armed conflict, violence, violations of human rights or natural or human-made disasters, and who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an internationally recognized State border and remains on the territory of his own country. (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs)

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Yei. She sells food at a food stall, and has been in business for one year. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school. 

Betty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase cassava flour and maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and maize for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Yei. She is 28 years old, married and has two children; all of them are still in school. She sells food at a food stall and has been in business for one year. 

Stella heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer; this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase cassava flour and maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and maize.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in Yei. She has a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Three of them are still in school. 

Janet heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old and married to Hillary. They have been blessed with three children, ages 14, 12, and 8. She owns a retail shop, a business she has been in for four years. She earns a monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

Esther has requested a loan worth 50,000 KES to purchase bundles of baking flour, 100 kgs of cooking fat, and a sack of sugar.

The profit she earns would be ploughed back into her business. Her dream is to see her family excel in life. This is her third loan.

loans.use: To puchase bundles of baking flour, 100 kgs of cooking fat, and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Jose Trinidad

texts.es:
Jose Trinidad, de 55 años de edad, soltero y  padre de 5 hijos  con quienes vive en San Pedro Sula.
Don Jose, se ha dedicado a la venta de verduras y frutas y churros desde hace dos años, adicionalmente  también vende artículos electrodomésticos y de carros en mal estado y desechable como chatarra. 
El inicio con fondos propios comprando y vendiendo solo chatarras y vio la necesidad de un negocio de venta de verduras  y  frutas, pues logró establecerlo. Anteriormente él trabajaba como motorista y guardia en una empresa privada. Con este negocio trabaja 12 horas diarias.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras para surtir el negocio de frutas, verduras y chatarras para la venta.
El espera crecer en el negocio para brindar un mejor servicio y calidad de los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Jose Trinidad is 55 years old and single.  He has five children, and he lives with them in San Pedro Sula.

Jose has been selling fruit, vegetables, and churros for two years.  He also sells domestic appliances.  He sells junk that he gets from cars that are in bad shape and disposable.   He started with his own funds, and he was only buying and selling junk.  He saw the need for a business to sell fruits and vegetables, and he managed to establish it.

He used to work as a driver and a guard for a private company.  With this business he works 12 hours a day.

He is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras to stock his business with fruits, vegetables, and junk to sell.  He hopes to grow in his business and to provide better service and a better quality of products that he sells.

loans.use: to stock his business with fruit and vegetables and to buy junk to sell.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru:
Нургул 35 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. В 2002 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Нургул начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Нургул на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 дойная корова, 2 головы телят, 1 лошадь. Доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нургул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Nurgul is 35 years old, married and raised three children. In search of a source of income for her family, Nurgul became involved in animal husbandry in 2002, having started this business with an initial amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Today, her business contains a dairy cow, two calves and one horse. The earnings from sale of milk and meat products amount to about 5,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Nurgul requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 46 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy trabajadora, convive con Sinesio de 57 años y tiene cinco hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes y por quienes trabajó mucho durante estos años, ahora, ella y su esposo trabajan juntos con el fin de reunir dinero y tener una vejez tranquila. Zoila, todos los días por las mañanas hace las tareas de su hogar, de ahí se dirige a su chacra en donde tiene dos galpones para criar pollos, tiene al rededor de 2500 pollos bebés, que necesitan los cuidado necesarios para hacerlos crecer y venderlos en el mercado de pollos que hay en su ciudad. Ya realizó éste tipo de trabajo en veces anteriores, pero primera vez de tan grande magnitud. Durante sus 15 años en este negocio aprendió a como dar buen cuidado a las aves para que pedan salir al mercado con el peso ideal. Le gusta de su trabajo, ya que puede generar ingresos para su hogar sin tener que depender de otras personas, además que está a lado de su pareja. Ahora sus clientes esperan el tiempo para comprar pollos grandes. Si embargo necesita de capital para comprar alimentos balanceados y algunos equipos para continuar con la crianza. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá una poyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por su parte ella se compromete en pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará alimento para pollos balanceados y algunos equipo de tomar agua y riego mecanizado para los bebederos ya que solo necesita regular la alimentación para que pueda empezar a vender sus pollos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 46 years old, is a good, kind, and very hard-working woman who lives with Sinesio who is 57. They have 5 children, for whom they worked very hard over the years. All are now grown and independent. At present, Zoila and her husband work together with the goal of saving money for a tranquil old age. Every morning Zoila does her household chores, then heads for her farm where she has 2 sheds for raising chickens. She has around 2,500 baby chicks who need the required care to make them grow sufficiently to be sold in the city's chicken market.

Zoila has done this type of work in the past but this is her 1st time on such a large scale. During her 15 years in this business she learned to provide her birds with good care so that they can go to market at the ideal weight. She enjoys her work because it generates income for her home without having to depend on other people, and because she can work alongside her husband.

Now the time is approaching for her customers to buy large chickens and she needs the capital to buy chicken feed and some equipment to continue raising chickens. This will be her 5th loan through MFP. Zoila is very content to know that she will have financing, enabling her to feel secure in advancing her business. On her part, she promises to make payments punctually, as with past loans. In addition, she is very content to belong to her communal bank, because everyone is responsible and supportive.

With the loan of 2,500 new sols, Zoila will purchase chicken feed and some equipment to provide drinking water and mechanized delivery of water to the dispensers; then she just needs to regulate feeding to be able to begin selling chickens.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens and water dispensers plus mechanized equipment to deliver drinking water to the dispensers.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is the mother of six children. Three of them work, while the other three are very young in age and remain at home. 

She is 50 years of age and supports her family by operating a milk sales business. Her work is home-based. She has a buffalo and sells its milk to her community clients to earn an income for her family. 

Her husband works in the vegetable market with his three sons. 

Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for further improvement of her dairy business. With the loan investment, she will buy another buffalo for her dairy business. This will help her to get a larger quantity of milk for selling to her clients and will increase her sales and income. 

She is confident about her business success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Oneste

texts.en:
Oneste lives in Yei. She has a food stall and has been in business for five years. She is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Both of them are still in school. 

Oneste heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase cassava flour and maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour and maize for resale.

loans.name: Mukhabat

texts.ru:
Мухабат 34 года, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. В 2003 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Мухабат начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Мухабат на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 3 головы телят,40 голов овец. Доходы от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляют примерно 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мухабат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Мухабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Mukhabat is 34 years old, married and raised three children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Mukhabat became involved in animal husbandry in 2003, having started this business with an initial amount of 5,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains two dairy cows, three calves and forty sheep.  The earnings from sale of milk and meat products amount to about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Mukhabat requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Maksuda

texts.ru: Максуда трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Супруга работает в Российской  Федерации. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Данный бизнес она начала с мужем, но когда её муж уехал в Россию, она сама продолжала эту деятельность с помощью братьев. Максуда хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия и с этой целью запрашивает займ в размере 3600 Сомони для ремонта своего дома. Она хочет отремонтировать фасад дома.
texts.en: Maksuda is a hardworking woman.  She is married and a loving mother of three children.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation.  Maksuda has been involved in buying and selling cattle for over five years.  She started this business with her husband, but when he went to Russia, she continued this business with the help of her brothers.  Maksuda wants to improve her living conditions and, to achieve this goal, is requesting a loan in the amount of 3600 Somoni to repair her house.  She wants to fix the facade of the house.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Vugar

texts.ru:
Vugar jenat imeyet 3 prekrasnix detey. On jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Vugar 43 qoda. On uje 7 let kak imeyet magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Vugar nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit pisheviye produkti(v osobennosti molochniye produkti) dlya prodaji v svoyom magazine i tem samim razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Vugar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. 

Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Vugar is married and has 3 wonderful children. He and his family live in the Fuzuli region. Vugar is 43 years old, and for the past 7 years he has been running his own grocery store. Vugar needs 1600 AZN to buy food (particularly dairy products) to sell in his store and thereby keep developing his business. Vugar is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy food products for sale in his store

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, de 36 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, convive con Nelsi de 28 años y con quien tiene un menor hijo a quien llama Rafael de solo 2 años. Él vive en su casa propia a lado de su hijo y su pareja. Todos los días, desde muy temprano, Rafael sale a las diversas calles de la ciudad, va en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros, quienes buscan una movilidad que les transporte junto con sus cargas dentro de la ciudad y en algunos casos a los alrededores. Además de éste trabajo, también se dedica en algunas veces a la albañilería, su especialidad son los pisos y vaciado de columnas en las diversas obras de la ciudad, depende de cómo está el mercado laboral es como brinda sus servicios. Lleva realizando su trabajo 15 años y aprendió todo lo que sabe sobre construcción por su padre, a quien agradece mucho por los consejos brindados. Le gusta su trabajo, pues le da buenas ganancias, aunque es muy agotador debido a que tiene que estar en el sol y a veces en la lluvia, él lo realiza de la mejor manera pues dice que con tal de ver feliz a su familia es capaz de eso y mucho mas, ahora está pensando en poner un negocio en su casa para que lo administre su pareja, pero antes desea tener una mototaxi mas y alquilarlo para tener un ingreso adicional. Este será el segundo préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará algunas piezas y repuestos para refaccionar su vehiculo, debido a que con el tiempo y el mal estado de las pistas de la ciudad lo ha ido deteriorando, además comprará algunas herramientas de construcción para empezar a agarrar obras el solo.
texts.en:
Rafael is 36 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking man.  He lives with 28 year old Nelsi and they have a two year old son named Rafael Jr.  He lives in a home of his own, along with his wife and son.  Each day Rafael goes out very early to the different streets around the city to look for his eventual passengers who are seeking travel for themselves and their cargo around the city, or at times to the outskirts.

Aside from this work, he also works sometimes as a mason, specializing in floors and columns in the various jobs in the city.  How he offers his services depends on how the labor market is.  He has been doing this kind of work for 15 years and he learned everything he knows about construction from his father, whose advice he appreciates.  He likes his work because it provides him with good earnings, even though it’s very exhausting because he has to be in the sun and sometimes in the rain, but he does the best he can.  If he can see his family happy, then he is capable of all that and much more.  Now he’s thinking about starting a business out of his home that his wife can manage, but first he wants to have a moto-taxi, so that he can lease it out to produce additional income.

This will be his second loan through MFP and he is very grateful to know that he has financial support and he feels sure to be able to advance his work.  He is also committed to making his payments on time, as he has with previous loans.  He is also glad to be part of his communal bank because all of the members are united and responsible.  He will the 1,500 from this loan to buy some parts and spares to repair his vehicle, because it needs repair due to wear over time.  He will also buy some construction tools so that he can work on his own.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina, de 42 años de edad casado con juvenal de 40 años fruto de esta relación tienen 02 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la urbanización valle dorado del distrito de Pichari. Clementina es una mujer muy solidaria, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su ciudad. Pero antes se dedicaba al cultivo de productos agrícolas y con la producción que obtenía logró juntar un capital más. Ahora con el préstamo de MFP compró productos de primera necesidad, como también agradece a la junta de comerciantes quienes la facilitaron un puesto a modo de alquiler en donde expenderá sus productos.
Es su primer negocio por el que clementina tendrá que esforzarse mucho con la finalidad de que pueda realizar buena venta. Clementina dejó el cultivo agrícola en manos de su esposo, quien continuará acrecentando más su producción. Ella está contenta  con su nuevo trabajo, pues mas adelante esta pensando crecer con su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará mercadería.
texts.en:
Clementina, who is 42 years old, is married to Juvenal, who is 40, and they have two children. They live in their own house located in the Valle Dorado housing development in the district of Pichari. Clementina is a very community-minded person. She sells groceries in the market in her city, but in the past she raised agricultural products, and with the production that she obtained she managed to get a little more capital together. Now, with the loan from MFP, she will buy basic products, and she is also thankful to the group of merchants who facilitated her renting a stall where she now sells her products.

This is her first business, so Clementina will have to make a lot of effort with the goal of having good sales. She left the agricultural work in the hands of her husband, who will continue increasing their production. She is happy with her new work, since in the future she is thinking of expanding her business. This is her first loan with MFP, and so she promises to make her payments punctually. With the 1500 PEN that she has applied for, she will buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 30 лет, замужем,  воспитывает сына.   Назира работает преподавателем  в местной школе и  поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, в 2005 году Назира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Назиры, ее поголовье насчитывает 3 дойные коровы и  6 овец, что приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить частично в ремонт дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Nazira is 30 years old, married, and raising a son. She works as a teacher at a local school. While looking for a source of additional income for her family, in 2005 Nazira launched her own livestock business with an initial sum of 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazira's persistent and dedicated work, her herd currently has 3 dairy cows and 6 sheep, and earns her roughly 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, Nazira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest a portion of her profits from this loan into repairing her home, and later - into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kubra's Group

texts.en:
Kubra has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband, who operates a hair and body oil sales business. With the loan investment, he will buy different kinds of hair and body massage oils for selling to his clients. He handles a good clientele and also sells his products by visiting different areas and places. 

He is very experienced in his business and his clients are very happy with his products because he sells them pure oil at very reasonable rates.
 
Kubra also does work. She is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients to earn profits for her family. This income helps her with paying utilities and the school fees of her children. 

She has given birth to six children. Two of them work, while the others are enrolled in a nearby school and are continuing their education. 

Kubra is very confident about the better financial future of her family as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair and body oils for her husband's business.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Гулнар  50 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Гулнар работает операционной медсестрой  и в качестве дополнительного дохода -  с 1992 года занимается животноводством и пчеловодством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 1 ,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Гулнар имеется 2 головы дойных коров, 10 голов овец, 1 лошадь и 30 семей пчел, доходы от хозяйства составляют примерно 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп 1 дойной коровы, 4 овец и дополнительного количества пчелосемей, так как из-за холодной зимы часть пчел погибла .  Доходы от кредита Гулнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulnar is 50 years old. She is married and has raised 3 children. She works as an operating room nurse, while also raising livestock and keeping bees as a source of additional income. Gulnar started her business with an initial investment of 1,000 som (KGS), and presently keeps 2 dairy cows, 10 sheep, 1 horse and 30 bee hives. The average monthly income from the business is 20,000 som (KGS). 

In order to continue developing her business, Gulnar has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 115,000 som (KGS) to purchase another dairy cow and 4 sheep, as well as additional bee families since some of them died due to the cold winter. Gulnar plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and bee families

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina de 27 años de edad convive con Amílcar de 32 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos, juntos  viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de Yurinate del distrito de Pichari. Paulina, es una mujer dedicado al cultivo de productos agrícolas sobre una parcela que posee, ubicado dentro de su comunidad. Ahi cultiva cacao y plátano desde hace muchos años atrás, siendo la producción vendida a los acopiadores, quienes se encargan del traslado, inclusive en el secado, es por ello que paulina ya no se dificulta tanto en la cosecha, pues antes ella tenía que trasladar los pesados sacos de cacao juntamente con su esposo para poder expenderlo. Por otro lado se dedica a la extracción de madera pero éste trabajo lo realiza su esposo con 2 personales que también les genera un buen ingreso económico. Es de esta manera que paulina trata de obtener su propio ingreso con la finalidad de que a sus menores hijos no les falte nada. 
Ahora está contenta con el trabajo que realiza, porque le genera una buena rentabilidad ya que sus productos son bien cotizados, mas adelante esta pensando continuar expandiendo sus plantaciones de cacao. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete una vez más en cancelar
Puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 4,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Paulina, 27, lives with Amílcar, 32, and they have two children.  They live together in their own house located in the community of Yurinate in Pichari District.  

Paulina is a woman who works growing farm products on a parcel of farmland she owns located in her community.  She has grown cocoa beans and bananas there since several years ago; she sells her harvests to grain consolidators who take care of the transport and even the drying.  This is why harvesting isn’t quite so difficult for Paulina any more because it used to be that she and her husband had to transport the heavy sacks of cocoa beans together in order to sell it.  

On the other hand, she also harvests wood but this is a task her husband does with two employees and this also generates good income.  In this way Paulina tries to earn her own income so that her children will have everything they need.  She’s happy with the work she does now because it produces good profits because her products command good prices.  Later on she plans to expand her cocoa bean plantations.  

This is her second MFP loan so she once again commits to make her installment payments punctually.  She will use the 4000 new soles to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Lesly Haydee

texts.es:
Lesly  de 39 años de edad, está casada desde hace 18 años, tiene 3 hijos de 9, 16 y 18 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en empresa privada, vive en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Lesly, hace 10 años que comenzó vendiendo baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena de frijoles, huevo, queso, mantequilla y otros), pero su demanda creció y le pedían otra clase de comidas,  esto la motivo a  vender  almuerzos, desayunos y cenas también. Abre su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche atendiendo su clientela.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 25,000.00 lempiras a ODEF para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas, como ser carnes, verduras, harina, frijoles, arroz, condimentos etc.
Como meta ella piensa incrementar sus clientes ofreciendo variedad de comida.
texts.en:
Lesly, 39, has been married for 18 years; she has three children who are 9, 16, and 18 years old.   Her husband works for a private firm.  She lives in a neighborhood in the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.

Lesly started selling “baleadas” (flour tortilla filled with eggs, cheese, butter and others) ten years ago but demand grew and they asked her for other types of dishes.  This motivated her to sell breakfasts, lunches and dinners too.  She opens her business from 7 in the morning until 9 at night taking care of customers.

She’s asking for a 25000 lempira loan from ODEF to buy ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes like meats, vegetables, flour, beans, rice, condiments, etc.  Her goal is to increase her clientele by offering a wider variety of food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ingris Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Ingris de 38 años de edad, es  madre soltera, ella vive con sus tres hijas en  un barrio de la ciudad de  Amapala, Doña Ingrid se dedica desde hace 06 años a la venta de ropa nueva. Su venta es de manera ambulante.
Doña Ingris esta solicitando 20,000.00 lempiras para la compra de productos como ser: trajes de baño para la época de semana santa, sandalias, Ropa Interior y Cremas que son los productos que sus clientes le han pedido. 
 Doña Ingris con las ganancias pretende mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, y también desea ampliar su negocio. 
El sueño de Doña Ingris es  abrir en negocio de golosinas para esta época que es muy visitada por los turistas que vienen a las playas a veranear.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Ingris, who is 38 years old, is a single mother. She lives with her three daughters in a neighborhood of the city of Amapala. Doña Ingris has worked for 6 years in the sale of new clothing. She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.

Doña Ingris is applying for 20,000 lempiras to buy products such as swimming suits for the Easter season, sandals, underwear, and lotions, which are the products that her clients have asked for.

With her earnings, Doña Ingris seeks to improve her living conditions and those of her family, and she also wants to expand her business.

Doña Ingris' dream is to open a candy store for this season, in which there are many visits by tourists, who come to pass the summer at the beaches.

loans.use: to purchase bathing suits for the Easter season,  and sandals, underwear, and lotions for her business

loans.name: Begimjan

texts.ru:
Бегимжан 50 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 2000 году Бегимжан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с покупки 2 дойных коров. Благодаря упорному труду Бегимжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 5 дойных коров,20 овец, ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет примерно 5,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бегимжан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Бегимжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Begimjan is 50 years old, married, and has three children. While searching for a source of income for her family, in 2000 Begimjan started her own livestock business by buying 2 dairy cows. Thanks to her persistent work, her farm currently has 5 dairy cows and 20 sheep, and makes roughly 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Begimjan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. Begimjan is planning to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Heriberta, tiene 41 años de edad, ella tiene 1 hijo, Su actividad principal es la venta de productos de consumo diario desde hace más de 10 años, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para el manejo de su negocio.
Doña Heriberta esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de Café, Azúcar, Arroz, Frijoles, Verduras, Pastas, Condimentos y Otros Productos de consumo básico para la venta ya que algunos de sus clientes le han hecho pedidos y necesita capital para poder cumplir sus demandas.
Doña Heriberta esta segura que dedicándose al negocio y con la ayuda de su esposo podrán darle una mejor vida a su hijo y darle la educación necesaria.
El sueño de Doña Heriberta es que su hijo sea un profesional y que sus negocios crezcan y sean muy fuertes.
Glenda se dedica a la venta de pantalones, camisas, camisetas, ropa interior y venta de cerdos.
Alejandrina, tiene 38 años de edad, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería).

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Heriberta, 41, has a son.  Her main activity is selling basic staple items; she’s been in business more than ten years.  Her husband helps her run her business.

Heriberta is asking for a loan to buy coffee, sugar, rice, beans, vegetables, noodles, condiments and other basic staple items to sell since some of her customers have made requests and she needs capital to meet demand.

Heriberta is sure that if she devotes herself to the business and with help from her husband they will be able to give their son a better life and the necessary education.

Heriberta’s dream is that her son becomes a professional and that her businesses grow and become very strong.

Glenda sells pants, shirts, t-shirts, underwear and pigs.

Alejandrina is 38 years old and her main activity is selling groceries (grocery store).

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras – March 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Mujeres De Lucha Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Bertilia, tiene 48 años de edad, ella tiene un hijo, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería y la costura desde hace más de 6 años, ella vive con su pareja de hogar, Doña Bertilia esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico, maíz, frijoles y telas para la elaboración de faldas, camisas y pantalones para la buena atención de sus clientes, su negocio esta ubicado en su hogar, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba, a Doña Bertila le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ella trabaja  muy duro para contar con el patrimonio familiar.
Doña Bertila uno de sus sueños es tener una de los mejores pulperias de la zona.
La Señora Mirta, se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería).
La Señora Elvira, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de galletas, pan doblado, porciones de pollo, enchiladas y otras golosinas.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Bertilia is 48 years old, has a husband and a son, and has been selling grocery items and sewing as her primary business activities for more than 6 years.  Bertilia is requesting support in order to purchase products such as sugar, butter, soap, sodas, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and fabric to make skirts, shirts and pants for her customers.  Her business is located in her home, and the requested loan will contribute to Bertilia improving her business and as a result having better earnings to cover household costs and being more able to give a better quality of life to her family, which is important to her.  One of Bertilia's dreams is to have one of the best grocery stores in the area.  

The rest of the group consists of Mirta, who earns a living selling groceries as well and Elvira who sells cookies, bread, chicken enchiladas and other food items.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012

loans.use: to purchase sugar, butt, soap, sodas, meat, toilet paper, corn, beans and fabric for their business.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is 40 years old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen with his life partner and four children. He sells cosmetics. He has been engaged in this business for 16 years and, thanks to his hard work and dedication, he has remained busy all this time. He has had very favorable results in his business because he always tries to stay one step ahead of the competition, offering a variety of cosmetics at the best prices. He has very good references from his clients who say they are very satisfied with the service Jameel provides. 

Every day he makes a greater effort because his dream is to be able to give his family a better quality of life. His family is everything to him. It is for them that he strives daily to get ahead so that he can give them better opportunities in life. He has been thinking about growing his business, and for this reason, he decided to apply for a loan of 500,000 Yemeni rials from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of products such as perfumes, lotions and handbags, etc. He has noticed that these products are in high demand and wishes to put emphasis on them in order to increase his sales. This will result in higher income which will enable him to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as perfumes, lotions, and handbags, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Nelson Efrain

texts.es:
El señor Nelson tiene 28 años de edad y vive en un barrio ubicado en una aldea rural de Peña Blanca Cortes,  es casado, su esposa se dedica al comercio,  tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 4  años de edad. 
Nelson mantiene a su familia  con las ventas de su pulpería. Empezó su negocio con el poco dinero que tenía ahorrado. En la pulpería vende productos de la canasta básica como leche, carne, huevo, arroz, frijol y recargas telefónicas. Le va muy bien en su negocio lo tiene bien surtido y por lo tanto sus ingresos son considerables. Don Nelson  trabaja todo el día para atender bien a su clientela.
 Con el préstamo actual de 25, 000 lempiras,  Nelson va a aumentar su inventario de estos productos abasteciéndose de harina, arroz,manteca, Frijoles y de más productos alimenticios. . Espera crecer más y superarse para darle a su familia una vida más cómoda. Le importa mucho la educación de sus hijos y espera poder darles la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Nelson, 28, lives in a neighborhood located in a rural village in Peña Blanca, Cortes.  He’s married and his wife’s a merchant.  He has two children who are 11 and 4 years old.

Nelson supports his family with his grocery store sales.  He started the business with a little money he had saved.  He sells basic staple items in his grocery store like milk, meat, eggs, rice, beans and mobile phone recharges.  He does very well in his business; he keeps it well-stocked so his income is considerable.  Nelson works all day to provide good customer service.

With the current 25000 lempira loan Nelson is going to increase inventory stocking up on flour, rice, lard, beans and other foodstuffs.  He hopes to grow and improve more to give his family a more comfortable life.  His children’s education is very important to him and he hopes to give them the best education possible.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces, venta de coca, costura de pantalones, carnicería, venta de telas, venta de carne, venta de verduras, macramé, venta de artículos de plásticos.

La señora Juana, indica que hace un año que conforma una asociación comunal ingresando por invitación de una compañera de trabajo. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de verduras, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de verduras) que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The community bank "Flor Naciente" will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional center. The group is composed of eight members, and they have a board of directors where Señora Juana is treasurer. The businesses of the members of the group are varied: among them we have selling sweets, selling coca, sewing pants, butcher shop, selling fabric, selling meat, selling vegetables, macramé, and selling plastic articles.

Señora Juana says that a year ago she put together a communal bank at the invitation of a co-worker. At this time she has a business selling vegetables, which she has done for years. The loan from this loan cycle is to expand her merchandise (buy vegetables), which she buys in the city of El Alto and then sells at her fixed stall. This form of work allows her to support her family, since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health center.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 59 años, es una mujer amable y muy buena, está casada con Juan de 65 años con quien tiene tres hijas a quienes educaron y formaron hasta hacerlos personas de bien y responsables de sus propias familias. Vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo y trabaja mucho para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Lucy consiste en la venta de sabanas, cada cierto tiempo se va a la ciudad de Iquitos en donde compra juegos de sabanas exportadas y a su retorno se encarga de venderlos a crédito o al contado a sus diversos clientes que tiene. Durante estos 15 años de trabajo aprendió mucho y lo que mas resalta es saber brindar un buen trato al igual que cómodas cuotas a sus clientes para así asegurarse que siempre te serán fieles. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo a su disposición, ya que ella pone su horario, salvo algunas ocasiones que le dicen una hora exacta que tiene que ir a ofrecer y como es muy responsable está ahí hasta 15 minutos antes de la hora pactada. Aunque tiene muy buen mercado de clientes y está muy contenta de trabajar con ellos, está con ganas de hacer cosas nuevas, intentar aumentar su cartera de clientes y esto lo logrará por medio de una inversión más grande, para tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer. Este será el décimo tercer cerdito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar mas tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse mas con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará más mercadería, entre las cosas que desea invertir están: sabanas, fundas, cubrecamas, almohadas y algunas prendas de vestir para dormir.
texts.en: Lucy is a kind and good 59 years old woman who is married to Juan, 65, with whom she has three children who they have educated and raised up to be good people who are responsible for their own families.  She lives in her own home next to her husband and works a lot to be able to have a better quality of life.  Lucy's work consists of selling sheets; every so often she goes to the city of Iquitos where she buys imported sets of sheets, and upon her return she must sell them on layaway or in full to the many customers she serves.  During these last 15 years of work, she has learned a lot, most of which is to know how to treat customers well and to find a manageable price to pay per month for her clients so that they will always be happy.  She enjoys what she does, as it allows her to have free time since she makes her own schedule, except on rare occasions when her customers tell her the exact time that they need a particular item.  When this occurs, she always shows up 15 minutes earlier than the agreed upon time because she is so responsible.  Although she has a very good clientele and is very happy to work with them, she desires to do new things to try to increase her clientele, which she will be able to achieve with a larger investment, having a greater variety of products to offer.  This will be her thirteenth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support since it will allow her to be more at peace and to move forward with her business plans.  She is committed to make her payments in a punctual manner and to become more involved with the members of her community bank who are very socially committed.  With the requested loan of 3000 soles, she will purchase more merchandise, investing in things such as: sheets, pillowcases, bedspreads, pillows and some sleeping garments.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, pillowcases, bedspreads, pillows and sleeping garments.

loans.name: Sakina Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Sakina bibi is a 50-year-old married woman and she has seven children, all of whom are sons.

Sakina and her family are very talented. They all are involved in a shoe making business. This has become their family business. They all receive orders from the shoe factories and shoe shops and fulfill them to generate income.

Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With the loan investment, they will buy shoe making material like leather, nails, shoe polish, shoe laces, and thread in larger quantities to fulfill the orders on time and increase their income. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her family business.

loans.use: To buy shoe making materials for her family's shoe making business.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 41 years old, and she sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. To earn extra income she does farming. She describes her customers as low income earners because they live in the slums.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Salima has been able to save her income and hopes to grow her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 24 years old and married with one child. 

She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers. To earn extra income she does farming.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Concepción De Lourdes

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 35 años de edad, es casada su esposo reside en EE.UU. y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Peña Blanca, Cortes.
Concepción tiene un negocio de pulpería. Lo estableció hace 4 años con el objetivo de poder tener otro ingreso extra en el hogar y poder superarse. Ella ha logrado mantener su negocio con la buena administración y con l ayuda de su esposo que le envía remesas del extranjero. Vende productos alimenticos como, huevos, manteca, frijoles, azúcar, harina, leche, refrescos y productos de abarrotería como, jabón, desinfectantes, pastas dentales, papel higiénico entre otros. A su negocio le dedica tiempo completo para atender a sus clientes.
En la actualidad a solicitado un préstamo de 15,000 lempiras que invertirá en la compra de abarrotería como, papel higiénico, jabón para la lavar y de baño, desinfectante, pastas dentales etc. Para ofrecer mejor variedad de productos a los clientes y así su negocio pueda crecer aun mas en clientes.
