Su plan en el futuro es ampliar más el negocio y seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Concepción, 35, is married; her husband lives in the United States.   She has three children who are 14, 10 and 2 years old.  She lives in a village in Peña Blanca, Cortes.

Concepción has a grocery store.  She opened it four years ago aiming at having an additional source of income for her home and to be able to improve herself.  She’s managed to stay in business thanks to her good administration and with help from her husband who sends her money from abroad.  She sells food items like eggs, lard, beans, sugar, flour, milk, soft-drinks and grocery items like soap, disinfectant, toothpaste and toilet paper, among others.  She works full-time in her store to take care of customers.

She is currently asking for a 15000 lempira loan to buy grocery items like toilet paper, laundry detergent and bath soap, disinfectant, toothpaste, etc. to have more variety of products available for customers so that the business will grow with more customers.  Her plan for the future is to expand the business more and to continue working to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru:
Назгуль 29 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 2002 году Назгуль начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Назгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные  коровы,15 овец и лошадь. Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет примерно 5,000 сом (KGS). Параллельно  с животноводством Назгуль занимается полеводством - на сегодняшний день, кроме земельного надела мерою 1,44га с клевером, Назгуль собирается засеять пшеницей 11га богарной земли.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян, минерального удобрения и ядохимикатов.  Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 29 years old, married, and has four children. While searching for a source of income for her family, in 2002 Nazgul started her own livestock and crop business. Thanks to her persistent work, Nazgul's farm currently has 2 dairy cows, 15 sheep and a horse. Her monthly income from sales of milk and dairy products is roughly 5,000 som (KGS). At the same time, Nazgul grows crops and presently has a 1.44-hectare plot of land with clover, while also planning to sow wheat on 11 hectares of non-irrigated land.

In order to continue developing her business, Nazgul has turned to Bai-Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers, and pesticides. Nazgul is planning to invest her profits from this loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
Doña  Josefa, cuenta con una edad de 59 años, es una madre soltera, ella vive en su propia  casa junto a su hija y sus nietos en el  sur de honduras. El negocio de doña Josefa es la venta de tortillas y tamales el cual lo elabora en su casa y los vende en los diferentes lugares vecinos de la comunidad donde reside, Doña Josefa esta solicitando 8,000.00 Lempiras para la compra de maíz, verduras, leña, carne, hojas para envolver los tamales, condimentos y algunas herramientas que necesita para la elaboración de su producto. De esta manera mejorar sus ventas y así lograra mayores ingresos.
Doña Josefa entre sus sueños es mejorar su vivienda ya que en el lugar que donde hace sus tamales y tortillas le falta remodelar. Pero con el apoyo de este crédito ella podrá hacer  mejoras en su vivienda y tendrá mejor calidad de vida ella, su hija y sus nietos.




San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Josefa is a 59 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter and her grandchildren in southern Honduras.  Josefa's business is selling tortillas and tamales which she makes at home and sells in different areas close to the community where she lives.  Josefa is requesting 8,000 lempiras to purchase corn, vegetables, firewood, meat, leaves with which to wrap tamales, condiments and some tools that she needs for making her products.  In this way she will improve her sales and will achieve higher earnings.  

Josefa dreams of improving her home since the area where she makes her tamales and tortillas is in need of remodeling.  With the support of this loan she will be able to make improvements to her home and will have a better quality life for herself, her daughter and her grandchildren.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, vegetables, firewood, meat, leaves with which to wrap tamales, condiments and some tools she needs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and a table for her work area.

loans.name: Yessica Valentina

texts.es:
Yessica  tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, solo el mayor estudia,y vive en el Progreso, Yoro

Yessica es muy trabajadora hace 7 meses estableció un negocio de vender mercadería como ropa de damas, niños y ropa interior para damas la cual vende en su casa.  De este negocio ella obtiene los ingresos que le ayudan a complementar los gastos del hogar. Decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque se obtienen mejores ingresos dedicándole todo el día de 9.00 am hasta las 5.00 pm.

Es su primer financiamiento con ODEF de 12,000 lempiras el cual le ayudara en la inversión de surtir con más mercadería como Ropa de Niño, Damas y Ropa interior para  damas. para incrementar sus ventas y obtener una mejor ganancia para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.

Su meta es seguir invirtiendo para seguir trabajando y su negocio se mantenga estable .
texts.en:
Yessica, 29, is married and has two children who are 6 and 4 years old; only the oldest is attending school.  She lives in El Progreso, Yoro.

Yessica is very hardworking. Seven years ago she started a business selling merchandise like women’s and children’s clothes and women’s underwear that she sells from home.  From this business she earns income that helps her contribute toward household expenses.  She decided on this activity because good income can be earned from it working all day from 9am until 5pm.

This is her first ODEF loan for 12000 lempiras that will help her stock up on more merchandise like children’s and women’s clothes and women’s underwear to increase sales and obtain better profits to give her children a better life.  Her goal is to continue investing in order to continue working and that her business maintains itself stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Armenja

texts.es:
Doña  María  es  una  Señora de  55 años   de  edad, ella es muy  emprendedora  dedicada  a su  negocio, actualmente  vive  con  su  hija y sus nietos, ella vive  en la ciudad  de Choluteca. 
Doña María su  negocio  es una  bodega  de  abarrotería, ella allí vende muchos productos de consumo básico como Manteca, Azúcar, Frijoles, Arroz, Aceite, Margarina, Condimentos y Otros Productos.
Doña María necesita el crédito para  la  compra  de café, azúcar, harina, refrescos, cal, frutas, verduras, lácteos, pastas, churros y otros. Ella espera   que con este  préstamo pueda tener  más  ventas.
Doña María uno de sus sueños  es  graduar a su  hija  ya  que  en  este  año se  le  gradúa  como  maestra y también poner  otro negocio de los mismos para poder  ayudar a su hija para mejorar sus vidas.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
María is a 55 year old woman who is very enterprising and dedicated to her business.  She lives with her daughter and grandchildren in the city of Choluteca.

María’s business is a grocery store.  She sells many basic staple items there like lard, sugar, beans, rice, oil, margarine, condiments and other products.

María needs the loan to buy coffee, sugar, flour, soft-drinks, lime powder, fruit, vegetables, dairy products, noodles, snacks and others.  She hopes that with this loan she’ll have more sales.

One of María's dreams is that her daughter graduate; she will graduate as a teacher this year.  She also would like to open another similar store to help her daughter improve their lives.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise fo her store.

loans.name: Efren

texts.es:
Don Efrén es una  persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente  vive  con  su  esposa  y  sus  4 hijos, el vive en el municipio   namasigue. Departamento de  Choluteca. Don Efrén se  dedica  a su negocio  a tiempo completo.
Don Efrén el préstamo  lo necesita  para  la  compra  de  carnes, pollo, café, azúcar, harina, refrescos,  jugos y otros productos de uso diario.
Don Efrén espera tener en 5 años una pulpería convertida en un mini supermercado, ya que es una zona muy productiva y esto le ayuda a tener una visión más grande.
Además Don Efrén desea seguir trabajando duro para terminar de darle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan y así que  sean  personas  de  bien  para  poder  ayudar  a su familia, ya  que  son personas muy humildes y  pobres.


Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Efrén is a very hardworking person.  He currently lives with his wife and four children in the town of Namasigue in Choluteca Department.  Efrén works full-time in his store.

Efrén needs the loan to buy meat, chicken, coffee, sugar, flour, soft-drinks, juice and other basic staple items.  He hopes in five years that the grocery store has turned into a supermarket since it’s a very productive zone and this helps him to have a grander vision.  Besides, Efrén wants to continue working hard to give his children the necessary education so that they will become upstanding citizens and to be able to help his family since they are very humble, poor people.


Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en: Amani is a 21-year-old married lady. Her husband works in a clothing store and they still have no kids. Amani is a conservative person, so she asked her mother to take her place in the photo. Wanting to take advantage of the fact she still has no kids and has a lot of free time, Amani started a small business at home selling kids snacks and candy from home. She hopes that in the near future she can expand and bring in more food products to sell and later on she could open a store for selling food products. She has applied for this loan to buy more snacks and other basic food products like dried beans, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and other basic food products like dried beans, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Gulshan Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan naheed is a 38-year-old married woman and has seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a tailor while four others are getting an education from the nearby school and the remaining two are free and don’t do anything.

Gulshan is also a very dedicated and supportive woman in nature. She runs a juice corner but her work is home-based. She has some juicer machines with which she makes juices of fresh fruits to meet the requirement of her customers. Her husband is a mason on a meager income.

Gulshan has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. He runs a tailoring shop in the market from where he sews ladies' and gents' clothes. He is an expert in his work and handles his clients well. With the loan investment, he will buy another sewing machine and will hire an assistant to help grow his business. Gulshan is very confident about the further expansion of her son's business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her son's tailoring business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old, and she is married with one child. She sells sodas to earn a living. She has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as good because she has many regular customers.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jane has been able to save her income and hopes to grow her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy sodas to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas to sell.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is 30 years old, and she runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as good for the business because there is limited competition. She does farming to earn extra income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Felistus has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy sugar, maize flour, and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old, and he is married with 3 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 6 years and describes his business environment as good for the business. To earn extra income he sells used shoes.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Daniel has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy loaves of bread, sugar, and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: To buy loaves of bread, sugar, and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es: Simeón de 42 años de edad convive con María de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 02 hijos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Nuevo Ccatunrumi del distrito de Pichari. Simeón se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en moto desde hace 2 años. Cuenta que cuando inicio en esta actividad tenía mucha demanda por lo que percibía una ganancia favorable, pero en la actualidad ha bajado por la incrementacion de un transportistas y el costo de combustible muy elevado. Por ello Simeón tiene que salir al trabajo muy de madrugada para realizar una jornada con buenas ganancias. Sin embargo no está conforme con las ganancias, apenas cubre la alimentación y no le permite crecer, por lo que él está pensando abrir una tienda de abarrotes para que su esposa sea la encargada en administrarlo y así tener un ingreso más y solventar los gastos de la familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará mercaderías para empezar su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Simeón, 42, lives with María, 40; they have two children and live in their own house located in the populated settlement of Nuevo Ccatunrumi in Pichari District.  

Simeón has been providing mototaxi transportation services for two years.  He relates that when he started this activity it had much demand and he earned favorable profits.  However, lately demand has dropped because a transportation syndicate has grown and fuel costs are very high.  Because of this, Simeón has to start his work day at dawn to earn acceptable profits.  However, he’s not happy with his profits; they are barely enough to cover food costs and they do not lead to growth so he’s thinking about opening a grocery store that his wife can run so that there will be more family income to cover family expenses.

This is his first MFP loan so he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to buy merchandise to start his new business.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Loai

texts.en: Loai is a 22-year-old single guy. He works with his father in the entertainment business, participating in different types of parties – mostly kids' parties. Loai has applied for this loan in order to expand the business. With the expansion, they will be participating in more parties and festivals that are not exclusively for children. For that, he wants to buy DJ equipment.

loans.use: to buy DJ equipment

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela de 46 años de edad convive con Cayo de 50 años fruto de esta relación tienen 02 hijos, ellos viven en el centro poblado de Mantaro del distrito de Pichari. Estela, es una madre con mucho entusiasmo dedicado al negocio desde muy pequeña, pues se dedica a la preparación de pollos a la brasa, antes de ello contaba con un restaurante muy concurrido por los comensales del lugar, pero una mañana decidió cambiar el negocio porque vio que le generaría mejores ingresos como también tendría mayor tiempo para con su familia, siendo los  motivos que lo llevo a decidir en la compra de un horno eléctrico, que era el único que le faltaba para abrir su pollería restaurante, aundado a la buena sazón que tiene estela hicieron que el nuevo negocio sea exitoso hasta el momento. Habitualmente trabaja con la ayuda de su querido esposo y cuatro trabajadores; ella esta feliz con el negocio que tiene porque le genera un buen ingreso económico. Estela mas adelante está pensando abrir una sucursal en el distrito de Pichari, porque vio que es un mercado potencial. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Estela esta contenta con el banco comunal que tiene por que sus integrantes son puntuales y solidarios. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles incrementará mas muebles, y la remodelación (pintado y adornos)
texts.en:
Estela, 46, lives with Cayo, 50, and they have two children.  She lives in the populated settlement of Mantaro in Pichari District.  

Estela is a very enthusiastic mother who has been dedicated to business since she was very little.  She prepares grilled chicken.  Before that she had a very busy restaurant with lots of customers from the area but one morning decided to change her line of work because she saw that it would generate higher profits as well as leaving her time to spend with her family.  

These where the reasons for buying an electric oven which was the only thing she still needed to open her chicken restaurant.  Added to the tasty way Estela cooks, the new business has been successful to date.  

She usually works alongside her beloved husband and four employees.  She is happy with the business because it generates good income.  Later on, Estela is thinking about opening a branch in Pichari District because she sees a potential market there.

This is her second MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  Estela is happy with her communal bank because it has members who are punctual and supportive.  She will use the 3000 new soles to buy more furniture and to remodel (paint and decor).

loans.use: to buy paint, furniture and accessories to improve the appearance of her chicken shop.

loans.name: Wilson Arturo

texts.es:
El joven  Wilson es una  persona  muy trabajadora, actualmente  vive  con  su  esposa  y  su  1  hijos, el vive  en un caserío del municipio Namasigue, departamento de  Choluteca.
Wilson se  dedica  a su  trabajo  fijo  en  una empresa  camaronera  de esta zona.  El  préstamo  lo necesita  para  la  compra  de   canaletas y laminas  de  zinc.  Wilson con el impacto de este crédito podrá terminar de levantar las paredes de su casa y ponerle el techo para poder habitarla en un tiempo cercano.
Wilson espera  tener su casa ya  terminada ya que vive  en la  misma  casa con  sus  padres.
Wilson desea seguir  trabajando  duro  para darle a su hijo  la  educación y a su familia un techo para vivir.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Wilson is a very hardworking young man.  He lives with his wife and son in a hamlet in the municipality of Namasigue, Choluteca Department.

Wilson has a steady job at a local shrimp processing plant.  He needs the loan to buy roof gutters and metal sheeting.  With the impact of this loan Wilson will be able to finish erecting the walls in his house and install the roof so that he can start living in it shortly.  Wilson hopes to finish his house because he’s currently living with his parents. He wants to continue working hard to give his son an education and his family a roof.

Choluteca, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Intisar is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a conservative person, so she asked her husband, Taha, who helps her in the business, to take her place in the photo. She has five sons. Her husband has recently retired from the military, so he started helping his wife with her small food products store that is established at home. Now Intisar wants to build an outside room and turn it into a small grocery store. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to build an outside room and turn it into a small grocery store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa de 48 años de edad casado con Eleazar de 52 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Llochegua. Luisa es una mujer que por mucho tiempo viene dedicándose a la venta de prendas de vestir cuenta que al inicio sus ventas los realizaba de puerta en puerta de manera ambulante, algunas veces aprovechaba las ferias de los pueblos cercanos hasta que logró juntar un capital con el que hizo construir su vivienda en donde ahora vende prendas con mucha comodidad. Generalmente trabaja con la ayuda de su querido esposo quien hasta la actualidad continua con la venta en algunas ferias mientras que luisa es la encargada de abastecer de prendas desde la capital.
Ella está contenta con el negocio que tiene porque gracias a ello pudo realizar muchos anhelos, pero le falta mucho por hacer. Más adelante está pensando seguir con su negocio por que todo le va muy bien, aunque en temporadas de invierno las vías de acceso se hacen tan difíciles por las inclemencias de la naturaleza y el costo del flete se incrementa. Este es segundo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Luisa esta alegre por tener un banco comunal muy sólido y con buenos integrantes. Con los 3000 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de mas prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Luisa, 48, is married to Eleazar, 52, and they have two children; they live in their own house in Llochegua District.  Luisa is a woman who has been selling clothes for a long time.  She relates that at the beginning she sold door to door and sometimes took advantage of the street markets in nearby towns until she managed to save up capital to build her house which is where she now sells her garments much more comfortably.  She usually works with help from her beloved husband who to this day continues selling in some of the street markets while Luisa is in charge of buying stock merchandise in the capital.

She is happy with the business because thanks to it she was able to reach many of her dreams but she still has much more to accomplish.  Later on she’s thinking about continuing with her business because she’s doing very well in everything although in winter access roads become so difficult due to nature's inclemency and shipping costs increase.

This is her second MFP loan so she’s committed to make her installment payments punctually.   Luisa is very cheerful about having such a solid communal bank with good members.  She will use the 3000 new soles to buy more articles of clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан добрый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 16 лет занимается пошивом национальных сапог- масхи. У него отличный товар и много постоянных клиентов. Доходы от данного бизнеса покрывают все его расходы. Он даже оставляет деньги для сбережения. Два месяца назад от полученной прибыли он купил себе автомашину на которой перевозит свой товар.В данный момент он хотел бы получить займ для закупа сырья на пошив сапог-масхи.
texts.en: Hasan is a kind and hardworking person.  He is married and has two children.  He has been involved in sewing national maskhi boots  for over 16 years.  Hasan has excellent merchandise and many regular customers.  The earnings from this business cover all of his expenses.  He even has left-over money to save.  Hasan used his received profit to buy a car two months ago and uses it to deliver his merchandise.  Currently, he wants to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for sewing maskhi boots.

loans.use: to buy materials for making boots

loans.name: Nurviniso

texts.ru: Нурвинисо женщина с богатым жизненным опытом. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. У них дружная семья и они стараются создать хорошие условия в своем доме. Более 10 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Она знакома с этим видом бизнеса и знает все тонкости. Нелегко работать на земле, выращивать сельхозкультуры и получать доход. И у не это получается. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений. С наступлением весны  у нее начался новый сезон. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en: Nurviniso is a woman with a rich life experience.  She is married and has three children.  She has a friendly family, and they try to create good conditions in their house.  Nurviniso has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years.  She is familiar with this type of business and knows all of its nuances.  It is not easy to work on the land, grow agricultural crops and earn money, but she is able to accomplish this.  Nurviniso wants to obtain a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers.  Her new season starts with the beginning of spring.  She relies on your help and thanks you in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Abduraiim

texts.ru: Абдурайим опытный бизнесмен. Вот уже на протяжении 35 лет он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Он женат имеет шестерых детей. Жена и дети помогают в деле. Полученный доход идет на содержание семьи. Бизнес нелегкий ведь откорм скота требует больших усилий. Но это для него не преграда. Он хочет получить займ и приобрести несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Увеличить поголовье стада. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку. Он уверен, что добрые люди помогут его и поддержат в расширении бизнеса. Спасибо!
texts.en: Abduraiim is an experienced businessman.  He has been involved in fattening up and selling livestock for 35 years.  He is married and has six children.  His wife and children help with the business.  Earned income is used to support the family.  This business is not easy because fattening up livestock requires a lot of effort, but this is not a deterrent for Abduraiim.  He wants to obtain a loan and buy several heads of cattle and small livestock in order to increase heard headcount.  Abduraiim relies on your help and support.  He is certain that kind people will help him and support him in expanding his business.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy cattle and small livestock

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, ella vive junto a sus 3 hijos y su esposo, sus hijos trabajan y estudian y su esposo se dedica a su taller, ella y su familia son de La Venta, Francisco Morazán.
El negocio de Doña María es la venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, catrachas, pollo frito, carne asada, pescado frito, refrescos, jugos, agua, entre otros productos de consumo rápido. Ella esta solicitando la cantidad de 10,000.00 lempiras para la compra de productos como Carnes, Pescado, Verduras, Refrescos, Agua, Jugos, etc. para elaborar golosinas y comida.
Doña María de esta manera piensa abastecer su negocio para que sus ingresos mejoren y que sus clientes encuentren variedad de alimentos.
Entre los planes de Doña María esta la compra de un freezer para meter sus productos perecederos.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
María, 50, is married and has three children.  She, her three children and her husband live together.  Her children work and study and her husband has a workshop.  She and her family are from La Venta, Francisco Morazán.

María’s business is selling snacks like tacos, enchiladas, meat pies, “catrachas” {fried corn tortilla with beans, “chismol” [chopped tomatoes, onion and cilantro with lemon and spices] sauce, cilantro marinated tomatoes, red onion and grated dry cheese}, fried chicken, grilled meat, fried fish, soft-drinks, juice and water among other fast-food items.

She’s asking for the amount of 10000 lempiras to buy products like meats, fish, vegetables, soft-drinks, water, etc. to make snacks and food.  María hopes this way to stock her business so that income will improve and her customers will find a variety of food available.  Among her plans is to buy a freezer to store her perishable products.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2912

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
Doña  Doris con una edad de 31 años, vive junto con sus hijos y a su esposo en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras. El negocio de Doña Doris es la venta de ropa  el cual la vende de la forma ambulante en las colonias de la ciudad y aldeas vecinas. Ella esta solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para comprar mercadería como pantalones de dama y caballero, blusas, camisas, ropa interior y trajes de niños. Y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para poder mejorar la  vida de  sus hijos.
El sueño de Doña Doris es establecer su propio local y para así poder generar mas ingresos y que sus hijos puedan lograr un buen nivel de educación y con el apoyo de este crédito ella cree que si lograra un mayor desarrollo en las vidas de su familia.  


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Doris, a 31 year old mother, lives with her husband and children in the city of San Lorenzo Valle, Honduras.  Doris' business is selling clothing which she sells door to door in the suburbs of the city and the neighboring towns.  She is requesting 5,000 lempiras to purchase merchandise such as women's and men's pants, blouses, shirts, underwear and children's outfits.  In this way she will be able to improve her earnings and as a result improve her children's lives.  Doris' dream is to establish her own store to be able to generate more profit and so her children can achieve a good level of education.  With the help of this loan, she thinks that her family life and possibilities will further develop.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase women's and men's pants, blouses, shirts, underwear and children's outfits for her business.

loans.name: Fanny Michelle

texts.es:
La señora Fanny, tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijas, ella y su familia viven en la zona sur de Honduras. El negocio de Fanny  es la venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos, tajadas, agua, refrescos y pollo frito.
Fanny esta solicitando la cantidad de 5,000.00 lempiras para la compra de Carnes, Pollo, Bananos Verdes, Harina, Repollo, Refrescos y Agua para elaborar golosinas. Con el apoyo de este tipo de créditos comprara productos para surtir su negocio y lograr incrementar el nivel de sus ingresos y aumentar sus clientes.
Entre los planes de Fanny esta la idea de construir su propia casa ya que donde vive es una casa familiar y sueña tener su casa propia para tener una mejor vida con su familia.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Fanny, 25, is married and has two daughters.  She and her family live in the south of Honduras.  Fanny’s business is selling snacks like tacos, enchiladas, meat pies, fried plantain, water, soft-drinks and fried chicken.

Fanny is asking for the amount of 5000 lempiras to buy meat, chicken, green plantain, flour, cabbage, soft-drinks and water to make snacks.  With support from this type of loan she will buy products to stock her business and manage to increase income levels and number of customers.  Among Fanny’s plans is the idea of building her own house because she currently lives in a relative’s house and she dreams with having a house of her own to have a better life with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2912

loans.use: to buy chicken, plantain, flour, cabbage, soft-drinks and water for her business.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Almost two years ago, Areej established a humble bookshop and stationary that sells basic stationary items that are used by most students. Her store is located close to a girls' school in the neighborhood. Areej is a 28-year-old married woman. She has two sons. Her husband works for a government entity. Now Areej wants to enhance the shop and add more items and products. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to enhance the shop and add more items and products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: After finishing high school, Mahmoud went to work for many retail companies to get business experience. Recently he started a small business by opening a home product store as shown in the photo. Now Mahmoud has applied for a loan to add more products to increase his revenue. Mahmoud is a 29-year-old single guy. He has one elder sister and two brothers.

loans.use: to add more home products

loans.name: Rinata

texts.ru:
«Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает признательность всем инвесторам КИВА, которые помогли Ринате в обретении кредита, использованного по целевому назначению и выплаченного в полном объеме. Она смогла расширить ассортимент товара и приобрести новых покупателей. Сегодня Рината обратилась за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от этого кредита будут направлены на расширение бизнеса.     



Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Rinata obtain her first Kiva loan, which were used as intended and repaid. She was able to broaden an assortment of goods and obtain new customers. Now Rinata has applied for a loan of KGS 60.000 for raising her turnover. Revenues from this loan will be used for broadening her business.
texts.en: "Bai-Tushum and Partners" expresses gratitude to all Kiva investors, who helped Rinata to obtain the loan, used in a goal-oriented fashion and repaid in full.  She was able to expand the selection of merchandise and attract new customers.  Today, Rinata requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to increase goods turnover.  The earnings from this loan will be used toward expanding the business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyne is 48 years old and a mother of two children aged eighteen and ten. For the past six years she has sold secondhand clothes, earning a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

Roselyne has requested a loan—her first—of 20,000 KES from KADET to buy a bale of skirts and blouses, and two bales of bedspreads. She plans to use her profits to buy additional stock as well as repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy a bale of skirts and blouses, and two bales of bedspreads.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
La señora  Hilda tiene 57 año de edad, ella se dedica desde hace doce años  a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, le gusta que sus clientes consuman fresca sus tortillas por eso las elabora tres veces al día, su actividad comienza a partir de las 5:00 AM para que a las 7:00 de la mañana sus clientes lleguen a comprarle, luego empieza a las 11:00 AM y su ultima producción es a la  5:00 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
Doña Hilda compra la Maseca los días miércoles y Sábado, sus ventas son fijas ya que sus clientes la visitan en su casa de habitación, este negocio le genera sus ingresos diarios, gracias a eso ella puede mantener a su hijo quien vive con ella y que por problemas en la vista no ha logrado conseguir empleo.
Doña Hilda esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de productos para la venta como manteca, papel higiénico, aceite, harina, azúcar, refrescos entre otros para volver poder ofrecerle a sus clientes ya que meses anteriores tuvo que dejar de vender por problemas en la zona.
Doña Hilda sueña con poder abrir su pulpería nuevamente y espera que PRISMA pueda apoyarle, otra parte del dinero la necesita para la construcción de un baño para tener mejores condiciones de vida.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Hilda, 57, has been making tortillas to sell for 12 years.  She likes her customers to consume freshly made tortillas so she makes them three times a day.  Her activity starts at 5am so that she can be ready when her customers come to buy at 7am.  Then she starts at 11am and her last production is at 5 in the afternoon every day of the week.

Hilda buys Maseca [brand of corn flour] Wednesdays and Saturdays.  Her sales are steady since her customers come by her house.  The business generates good daily income thanks to which she’s able to support her son who lives with her and who due to vision problems has been unable to find employment.

Hilda is asking for a loan to buy products to sell like lard, toilet paper, oil, flour, sugar and soft-drinks among others to once again offer to her customers because she had to stop selling them a few months back because of problems in the zone.

Hilda dreams with being able to open her grocery store once again and hopes that Prisma will be able to support her.  She needs another part of the money to build a bathroom for better living conditions.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – March, 2012

loans.use: to buy lard, toilet paper, oil, flour, sugar and soft-drinks, among others for her business.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke, a 37-year-old married father of three, has been operating a wholesale shop to earn a living for three years, and employs one person. To earn extra income he does sugarcane farming. Luke describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition.

Since joining Faulu Kenya, Luke has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand it into a supermarket in the future. He is now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy crates of eggs, bundles of maize flour and sacks of sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of eggs, bundles of maize flour, and sacks of sugar to sell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, de 49 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy trabajador, es conviviente con Nonia de 45 años y tiene dos hijos a quienes crían y educan para formarlos como personas buenas y útiles para la sociedad, sus hijos Noor de 18 y Boris de 16 años, ellos son el motivo para seguir adelante. Viven en su casa propia, inmueble que lograron comprar después de muchos años de ahorro. El trabajo de Orlando consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajero dentro y fuera de la ciudad, desde muy temprano por las mañanas, sale de su casa y se dirige al mercado mas cerca de su casa en donde espera a que algún eventual pasajero tome sus servicios y él se encarga de llevarlo sano y salvo a su destino. Durante todo el tiempo que lleva realizando su trabajo (18 años) ha aprendido muchas cosas y tiene algunos atajos y zonas en las cuales sabe que los precio tienen que ser un poco más elevado. Le está yendo muy bien en su trabajo, esto debido a que ya sabe como hacer su trabajo de mejor manera, además que le permite tener tiempo de ir a dejar y recoger a sus hijos del colegio. Está muy contento pues en algunas ocasiones tiene clientes que le contratan por horas y así puede trabajar menos y desgastar menos su motor, ahora espera mejorar las condiciones de su mototaxi y mas adelante comprarse un más para alquilarlo y tener un ingreso adicional. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, Por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy unidos y muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará repuestos y mandara a refaccionar algunas piezas que están deteriorándose con el tiempo de su mototaxi, además comprará un SOAT para llevar con garantías a sus pasajeros en su trayecto.
texts.en: Orlando is a good, kind and hard-working 49 year old man, who lives with Nonia, 45, and has two children who they are raising and educating so that they become good and useful people in society. His children are 18 year old Noor and 16 year old Boris, and they are his motivation for getting ahead.  They live in their own home, an estate that they were able to purchase after many years of saving.  Orlando's work consists of transporting passengers and freight into and out of the city, leaving very early in the morning from his house and going to the the closest market where he waits for passengers to take his motorcycle taxi.  He then is in charge of carrying them safe and sound to their destinations.  During the entire time that he has been carrying out this job, (18 years), he has learned many things and has several shortcuts and also areas in which he knows that prices have to be a bit higher.  His work is going very well due to the fact that he already knows how to carry out his job in the best way, as well as permitting him to have time to take his children to and from school.  He is very content, as on some occasions he has clients that contract him for hours at a time and which allows him to work less and to reduce the wear and tear on his motor.  Now he is waiting to improve the condition of his motorcycle taxi and to buy himself another one to rent out and gain an additional profit.  This will be his second loan with MFP, and therefore awaits your collaboration to continue with his goals.  He is also committed again to make his payments as in the other loans he has received.  He is very happy to be a part of his community bank since everyone is very united and responsible.  With the requested amount of 1000 soles, he will purchase replacement parts and will order repairs for a few parts that are deteriorating through time, as well as to purchase insurance to to be able to guarantee the passengers he carries to their destinations.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts and to repair his motorcycle taxi, and to be able to update his transportation insurance.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad  casado con Jesús de 49 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en el distrito de Llochegua. María, es una mujer luchadora, quien día a día se sacrifica por el bienestar de su querida familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, en un local alquilado desde hace más de 15 años. Cuenta que el negocio de bebidas es muy rentable ya que en esta parte del Perú el clima es calido a pesar de ello tiene poca competencia por lo que sus ventas día a día están mejorando; también prepara comida los días sábados y domingos algunas veces atiende pedidos, es de esta manera que María se gana el pan de cada día. El único inconveniente que tiene María es el desabastecimiento del agua potable que es muy importante para el negocio que ella tiene. María está contenta con la actividad que realiza; usualmente trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, además desea en adelante construir su local propio. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. María esta contenta con su banco comunal por que son responsables. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de bebidas.
texts.en:
María, 39, is married to Jesús, 49, and they have three children; they live in Llochegua District.  María is a tenacious woman who day to day strives or her beloved family’s wellbeing.  She has been selling beverages for more than fifteen years in a rented space.  

She relates that selling beverages is very profitable because in this part of Perú the weather is hot.  Despite that, however, she has little competition so he sales have been improving day to day.  

On Saturdays and Sundays she also prepares food and sometimes does so on special order.  This is how María earns her daily bread.  The only inconvenience María has is the shortage of potable water which is very important for the business she has.  

María is happy with her work.  She usually works with help from her husband and her children.  Later on she’d like to build a locale of her own.

This is her second MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  María is happy in her communal bank because they are responsible.  She will use the 2000 new soles to buy beverages.

loans.use: to buy a wider selection of beverages.

loans.name: Oscar Elvin

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 32 años e edad, es soltero, padre de tres hijos vive en casa de su madre en donde tiene su negocio de destazo de cerdos, ubicado en una colonia de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras.
Don Oscar se dedica desde hace ya 4 años  a la compra de cerdos para cría y destazo para la venta en las pulperías y de casa en casa, su medio de transporte es su bicicleta ahí el transporta el producto hacia los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo.
Don Oscar con el préstamo solicitado comprara dos vacas para cría y producción de leche.
Don Oscar con las utilidades de sus ventas desea seguir invirtiendo  en su negocio y comprando mas ganado para hacer crecer su granja y con la leche que el produce de su ganado ir trabajando en la compra de cerdos para el negocio de destazo.
El sueño de Don Oscar es construir su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Oscar, 32, is single and the father of three children.  He lives in his mother's house, where he has his business butchering pigs, located in a development in the city of San Lorenzo, Valle, in the southern part of Honduras.  For four years Oscar has been buying pigs to raise and butcher for sale in the local stores and from house to house.  His means of transportation is his bicycle, on which he takes the product to the neighborhoods and housing developments of San Lorenzo.

With the loan requested, Oscar will buy two cows to raise and produce milk.

With the profits from his sales, Oscar wants to continue investing in his business and buying more livestock to make his farm grow.  With the milk he produces from his cows he wants to go ahead in the purchase of pigs for his butchering business.

Oscar's dream is to build his own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, March 2012

loans.use: to buy two animals for his business.

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel, 32 years old, is a married lady whose husband works in a company as a sales supervisor.

Naheel has been doing her retail business for three years now, mainly selling blankets, clothes and home accessories. Now that her inventory is almost empty, she wants to bring in more products to increase her income and profit. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 45 years old and married with two children. Her husband earns an income for the family by operating a motorcycle transport concern.

For the past five years Regina has run a beauty salon. She says running a salon is a good enterprise because there is limited competition in the area. She has applied for a 60,000 KES loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a hairdryer and hair chemicals for the salon.

Because of Faulu Kenya, Regina has been able to educate her children. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and hair chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda, 39 years old, is a married woman. She has three daughters and three sons. Her husband works with the military. 

To help her husband support the family, Neda decided few years ago to start a small business selling make-up and cosmetic products. She hopes that one day she can open an accessories and make-up store. Now Neda has applied for this loan to add more cosmetics to the products she sells in her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar, 27 years old, is a married lady. She has a boy and a baby girl. Her husband is a farmer.

Living in an area that allows her to have an animal barn has given her the courage to open an animal sales business. She bought a few goats and sheep three years ago and has been expanding and increasing the number since then. Now Sahar has applied for this loan in order to buy food for the animals she has.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar de 25 años de edad convive con Alex de 28 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Mantaro del distrito de Pichari. Pilar se dedica al cultivo de Plátano y cacao en el centro poblado de Mantaro desde hace 5 años atrás. Al inicio empezó cultivando plátano seguidamente introdujo plantaciones de cacao que ahora ya están en sus primeras fructificaciones. Ella decidió cultivar cacao por que tiene un buen precio en el mercado al igual que el plátano, hasta la actualidad todo le va muy bien pero tiene un inconveniente su terreno agrícola esta al borde del río Apurimac y cada invierno que llega el río acrecienta y arrasa su cultivo, por eso esta pensando comprarse un nuevo terreno donde pueda seguir cultivando sus productos. Pilar está contenta con el trabajo que realiza pues gracias a su buena produccción su familia tiene una vida digna. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Pilar agradece a los que presiden su banco comunal por el buen trabajo que hicieron en el primer ciclo. Con los 2, 000 nuevos soles realizará el mantenimiento de parcela agrícola de cacao, contratando peones y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Pilar, 25, lives with Alex, 28, with whom she has two children.  They all live together in their own house located in the settlement of Mantaro in Pichari District. 

Pilar has been farming bananas and cocoa beans in Mantaro for five years.  At first she started farming bananas but soon introduced cocoa beans which are in their first fruit production phase.  She decided to grow cocoa beans because it has a very good market price like bananas.  To date, everything is turning out very well but her inconvenience is that her parcel of land is on the banks of the Apurimac River and every winter the river overflows its banks and washes away her crops.  Because of this she’s thinking about buying a new parcel of land where she can continue growing her crops.

Pilar is happy with the work she does because thanks to her good production her family has a dignified life.

This is her second MFP loan so she commits to make her installment payments punctually.  Pilar is grateful to those leading her communal bank because they did good work during the first cycle.  She will use the 2000 new soles to provide crop maintenance to her cocoa bean parcel hiring day laborers and buying sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 62 years old, and is married with three children. He runs a butcher shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 13 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. He describes his customers as low-income earners because they live in slums. To earn extra income he does farming.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Paul has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.name: Abdulhaq

texts.en: Abdulhaq, 61 years old, is married with a son and a daughter, Laila, who appears in the photo with him. After his retirement from the military, Abdulhaq opened a store to sell all kinds of farming needs such as seeds, insecticides, manure, etc. His daughter sometimes helps him in the store. Now Abdulhaq has applied for this loan to buy more of these products and new seeds to sell in the store.

loans.use: to bring more seeds and other farm supplies to sell in the store

loans.name: Adeebah

texts.en:
Adeebah is a conservative person who asked her husband who is also her partner to take her place in the photo.

Adeebah is 39 years old and married. She works with her husband. Both are tailors in their own tailoring workshop where they make female dresses, men's suits, and even military clothes. They are supporting five members in their family.  Adeebah has applied to this loan to buy more fabric and threads to increase their productivity.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and thread

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is twenty-six and single. For the past four years he has operated a butcher shop and raised pigs in Ruaka. From these enterprises he earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES.

This will be Anthony’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire 60,000 KES loan to increase his stock of meat in his shop. With the profits he wants to buy more piglets.

Anthony’s ambition is to get into the rental housing business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of meat.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old, and is married with two children. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Robert has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her work area and purchase quality fabric and other notions.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA” iniciará el decimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana María es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cafetería, venta de frescos, chantillin y galletas, servicio y venta de comida, comerciante de artículos varios, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, producción de pasteles.

La señora Ana María, indica que hace tres años que conforma una asociación comunal ingresando por invitación de una compañera de trabajo. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de videos, juegos, etc. que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su capital (compra de pal statión para difundir los videos) que adquiere de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” (Fortitude) communal bank will start its 18th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members and they have a governing board where Ana María is president.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have:  coffee shop, soft-drink sales, gelatin and cookies sales, service, food sales, assorted merchandise merchant, clothes sales, cosmetics sales and cake making.

Ana María indicates that she joined a communal bank three years ago having been invited by a coworker.  She currently has a business where she sells videos, games, etc. that she’s had for years.  The loan this cycle is to expand capital buying a PlayStation to play the videos that she’ll get in the city of El Alto and then install in her permanent stand.  This way of working makes it possible for her to support her family since she’s single and has three children.

loans.use: to buy a PlayStation 2

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old, and she runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Susan has been able to improve her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy beauty products.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei, South Sudan. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for 2 years. She is 26 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 38-year-old married woman and has one daughter who is 16 years old. Her daughter stays at home and helps manage the household work.

Bushra herself is a very talented lady. She works as a seamstress for her community clients. She sews designer and non-designer dresses easily. Her clients are very satisfied with her work and during her working years she never receives any complaint from her clients. She uses her earnings to pay off the utilities.

Bushra's husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items such as fruits & vegetables and construction supplies on his donkey cart and delivers the items to their destinations. He is very honest and committed to his work. Bushra has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying a new donkey cart because his current cart has become old and rotten from traveling through different areas. Bushra is hopeful that the new cart will allow her husband to get more orders and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for her husband's loading business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 48 years old and married with three children. For the past five years he has operated a butcher shop to earn a living (he also has a dairy from which he earns extra income). He says his butcher shop is profitable because there is limited competition in the area.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, James has been able to improve his family's living standards. He has now applied for a 80,000 KES loan to buy a bull for slaughter. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is fifty years old, single and the mother of three children aged 31, 28 and 13. For the past nine years she has sold secondhand clothes, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Jane has requested a loan—her first—of 25,000 KES to purchase more bales of children’s clothes and shoes to sell. She would also use her loan to repay it. Her ambition is to see her business expand.

loans.use: To purchase bales of children's clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is 34 years old and married with two children. For the past three years he has run a liquor store to earn a living. He says his customers earn little because they are slum dwellers.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business. He has applied for a 100,000 KES loan to buy more liquor to sell. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more liquor to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 37-year-old business man, and his wife Magdalene is a business lady. They are blessed with two children ages 7 and 4 years. He has been running a phone accessories outlet for the past 4 years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. John will use the loan to buy more cell phones to resell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy more cell phones for resale.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima lives in Yei, South Sudan. She sells clothes, and has been in business for two years. She is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Saima heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en:
Benedeta, 53 years old, is married to Joseph, a businessman. They are blessed with four children.

For the past three years Benedeta has been a tailor. She earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family.

Benedeta is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy fabric for her tailor shop. With the anticipated profits from her shop she will educate her children.

Benedeta’s ambition is to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old, and she runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mary has been able to improve her business and hopes to open many beauty salon branches in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy cosmetics and a hair drier.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en:
Lilias lives in Yei, South Sudan. She sells fish, and has been in business for four years. She is 30 years old and married with five children, all of whom are still in school. 

Lilias heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds (SDG) to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a 40-year-old lady and she is married with two children. She owns a salon business in Kenyatta market. She has been in the business for 9 years now and gets a monthly income of 200,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

This will be Miriam’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more salon materials and open another salon. 

With the profit, she wants to diversify the business. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more salon materials and open another salon.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda de 32 años de edad madre soltera con 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Mantaro del distrito de Pichari. Rayda se dedica al cultivo de cacao y plátano, se sacrifica muy arduamente por el bienestar de sus hijos haciendo las veces de padre. Cuenta que su esposo los abandono cuando aún el menor de sus hijos tenia 7 meses de nacido, desde aquel momento Rayda tuvo que pasar muchas peripecias trabajando como peón en donde le pagaban una miseria pero con el poco ahorro con el que contaba compró un terreno de cultivo donde plantó cacao y plátano, y actualmente cosecha el fruto de sus esfuerzos.
Normalmente trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos pero en temporadas de cosecha cuenta con la mano de obra de peones. Su producto los expende en el mismo centro poblado al mejor postor.
Rayda está feliz con su producción y esto es gracias a las técnicas agrarias que realiza. En adelante está pensando construir su vivienda. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el deshierbo de su parcela de plátano, contratando peones, además comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Rayda, 32, is a single mother with two children.  They live in her own house located in the town of Mantaro in the district of Pichari.  Rayda works growing cacao and bananas.  She makes hard sacrifices for the well-being of her children, serving as father.

She says that her husband abandoned them when the youngest of their children was still seven months old.  Since that moment Rayda had to experience many unexpected events working as a farmworker where they paid her a pittance.  But with the little savings she had, she bought a plot of land where she planted cacao and bananas, and currently she harvests the fruit of her efforts.

Normally she works with the help of her children, but in the harvest season she counts on the labor of farmworkers.  She sells her product in the same town to the highest bidder.

Rayda is happy with her production and this is thanks to the farming techniques she uses.  She is planning to build her house in the future.  This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises once again to make her payments punctually.

With the 3,000 nuevos soles (PEN), she will invest in weeding her banana plot and hiring farmworkers, and she also will buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers and to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and a single mother of three children aged 31, 29 and 27. For the past four years she has sold secondhand clothes and earns 15,000 KES a month.

She has requested a loan—her first—of 20,000 KES to buy two bales of sweaters and a bale of trousers. The profits she earns would help her repay her loan. Her ambition is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy two bales of sweaters and a bale of trousers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha, 19 years old and a single lady, has four older brothers and sisters.

Montaha has recently enrolled in the university to study Arabic language and literature so she can be a teacher or work in a related field. Now she has applied for this loan so she can pay her semester fees to move ahead in the education process.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La joven Magdalena de 28 años, es madre soltera, ella vive en casa de un familiar con sus dos hijos y radica desde hace 10 años en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. 
Magdalena tiene una pulpería en donde vende abarrotaría en general, refrescos, pan, agua en botellón, verduras y medicamentos.

Magdalena esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en compra de refrescos, queso, mantequilla, leche, medicamentos, azúcar, café, pan, manteca, etc.
Magdalena con las ganancias que genere el negocio espera que las condiciones de su negocio y de su familia mejoren. Y para el futuro desea prepararse mas en el oficio de belleza para abrir un salón donde pueda cortar cabello a los clientes de su pulpería y amigos y vecinos.
Magdalena sueña que sus hijos continúen estudiando hasta que se gradúen y construirles una casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Magdalena, 28, is a single mother who lives in a relative's house with her 2 children.  For 10 years she has lived in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.

Magdalena has a grocery store where she sells general grocery stock, including soft drinks, bread, bottled water, vegetables and medicines.

Magdalena is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, cheese, butter, milk, medicines, sugar, coffee, bread, lard, etc.

With the earnings she generates from her business, Magdalena hopes that her business and family life will improve.  In the future, she wants to get more training in the beauty trade so that she can open a salon where she could cut hair for her grocery customers, friends and neighbors.  Magdalena dreams of having her children finish their education, and of building a house for them.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cheese, butter, milk, medicines, sugar, coffee, bread, lard, etc., for her business

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet, thus the man in the photo is her husband.

Hanan is a  39-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children. She is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase fabrics for her business.

Hanan is looking to purchase an additional sewing machine to increase her sales volume and her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene de 49 años de edad, convive con Hugo de 45 años fruto de este amor tienen 2 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Llochegua. Rene es una madre trabajadora dedicada al cultivo de cacao y asimismo posee una parcela. Al inicio empezó cultivando arroz y plátano que son productos que necesariamente se siembra para que le pueda dar sombra a las plantaciones de cacao, mientras crezcan se aprovecha los frutos del arroz y plátano es de esta manera que Rene logró que sus plantaciones de cacao puedan prosperar de una manera satisfactoria. Usualmente ella trabaja juntamente con su querido esposo, quien se dedica al servicio de transporte.
Rene está feliz con esta labor que realiza, porque hasta la actualidad viene realizando buenas cosechas. En el futuro está pensando comprarse una parcela agrícola con la finalidad de seguir expandiendo sus cultivos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará la limpieza de una parcela nueva para poder sembrar plantas de cacao, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Rene, 49, lives with Hugo, 45.  They have two children from their love.  Together they live in their own house located in the community of Llochegua.  Rene is a hardworking mother who works growing cacao, and she also possesses a plot of land.

In the beginning she began growing rice and bananas, products grown necessarily to be able to give shade to the cacao crops.  While they grow, you make the most of the benefits of the rice and bananas.  In this way Rene managed for her cacao crops to prosper in a satisfactory manner.  Usually she works with her beloved husband, who works in transportation services.

Rene is happy with the work she does because she has had good crops so far.  She is planning to buy herself a plot of cropland in the future, with the objective of continuing to expand her crops.

This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the 3,000 nuevos soles (PEN) she will weed a new plot of land to be able to plant cacao plants.  She will hire farmworkers for this.

loans.use: to hire farmworkers.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 48-year-old married man from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a father of three children. He sells different kinds of goods. He works hand in hand with his wife, and they sell cosmetics, accessories and mobile phones prepaid cards.

Majed is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase more goods for business purposes. He is looking to expand his business by providing a shop for their goods with an aspiration of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase different goods for business purposes such as accessories, cosmetics and mobile phone prepaid cards

loans.name: Maria Patrocinia

texts.es:
La señora María de 65 años de edad, es casada, ella vive en su propia casa con su esposo y su nieto en una colonia de la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, su nieto va a la escuela y su esposo trabaja como vigilante aportando ingresos a su hogar.

Doña María se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de pan, frijoles, maíz, Maseca, refrescos, pollo, Etc. esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, frijoles huevos, jabón, azúcar, café, pan, etc.,
Doña María con las ganancias de este préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y su casa.
Sus metas son instalar bien el negocio y hacerlo crecer y en cuanto a la vivienda desea ampliar la casa construyendo un nuevo cuarto para su nieto.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2012
texts.en:
Sra. María, 65, is married and lives in her own home with her husband and grandson. They live in a neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. Her grandson goes to school and her husband works as a security guard to contribute to household expenses.

For the past 4 years, Doña María has sold bread, beans, corn, Maseca corn flour, soft drinks, chicken, etc. She is applying for a loan to purchase corn, firewood, beans, eggs, soap, sugar, coffee, bread, etc.

With the profits she earns she intends to improve both her business and her home. Her goals are to properly establish her business and make it grow.  With respect to her dwelling, she wants to expand her house  by constructing a new room for her grandson.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2012.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, beans, eggs, soap, sugar, coffee, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jacquelin

texts.es: Jacquelin de 30 años de edad convive con Efraín de 35 años, fruto de este amor tienen un hijo. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Llochegua. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir desde hace 5 años. Cuenta que incursionó en esta actividad gracias a su querida hermana que confecciona prendas en la capital, es ella quien la incentivo a realizar éste negocio dándole prendas, para que ella misma las venda, fue de esta manera que logró acumular su capital con el que adquirió más prendas, inclusive compró exhibidores para que sus prendas se vean mejor y que sus clientes se sientan atraídos. Generalmente ella trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo. Jacquelin está contenta con su negocio, porque cada día que pasa va incrementando su ingreso por las buenas prendas que vende. En adelante está pensando comprar un vehiculo para que pueda salir a las ferias que se realizan en los caseríos de su distrito. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2, 000 nuevos soles incrementara su mercadería.
texts.en: Jacquelin, 30, lives with Efrain, who is 35, and together they have a child.  They live together in their own home, located in the Llochegua district.  Jacquelin has been selling clothing for 5 years.  She tells us that she was able to invest in this business thanks to her dear sister, who makes clothing in the capital.  Her sister motivated her to start up this business by giving her clothing to sell.  In this way, she managed to accumulate some capital, which she used to buy more garments and also to buy some display units to exhibit her clothing better and attract more customers. Usually Jacquelin works with the support of her husband.  Jacquelin is happy with this business, because every day that passes she has been increasing her income because of the good garments that she sells.  In the future, she is planning to buy a vehicle so that she could go out to the markets that take place in the rural settlements in her district.  This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all of her payments on time.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles she requests, she will increase her inventory of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 35-year-old married man from Al Salt, Al Balqaa, Jordan and a father of five children. He started his business years ago by selling hot drinks out of a van then with his hard work he was able to expand his business into an established cafeteria selling sandwiches.

Now, Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase equipment and machines needed for improving his cafeteria.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and machines needed for his cafe

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 39-year-old woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. She does embroidery and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase a modern machine for embroidering.

Maryam is working from her house and she is looking to open a workshop for her business so that she can meet the increased demand for her products and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a conservative person and she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her son.

Ansam is a 41-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has a small grocery store. She started her business working from her house then she was able to move out into a small store near her home.

Ansam is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new goods for her  store.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a conservative person so she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her son.

Fatimah is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of one child. She works from her home and she has no shop for her business. She sells clothes and cosmetic products.

Fatimah is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase cosmetics and clothes for business purposes.  She is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase her income so that she can establish a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Suaad

texts.en:
Suaad is a 47-year-old married woman from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan and a mother of seven children. She is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase fabrics.

Suaad is currently working from her home where she receives orders from friends and neighbours, but she is looking to establish a workshop for her business so that she can increase her sales volume and her income as well.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Elsa Gloria

texts.es:
En la fotografía aparece la señora Elsa junto con su hija.
La señora Elsa tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija. Ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa, antes vendía en un cafetín junto con su hermana. La ropa la compra en diferentes ciudades del oriente del país en donde pueda comprar a un mejor precio.

Elsa solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más cantidad de ropa y la otra parte para reparar el vehiculo que tiene junto con su esposo, ya que necesita mantenimiento. Al invertir más en su negocio abra más oportunidad de obtener ingresos y al reparar su vehiculo solucionara el problema del transporte. Ella desea expandir su negocio a una ciudad del oriente del país, porque a identificado que existe un potencial.
texts.en:
Elsa and her daughter are shown in the photograph.

Elsa is 36, married, and has a daughter. She has a business selling clothing.  Before, she operated a small café with her sister. She buys the the clothing in various cities in the east of the country, where she can buy it at a better price.

Elsa is applying for a loan from Fundación Campo to buy more clothing. She will use the rest to repair the vehicle that she and her husband have, as it needs maintenance. 

By investing more in her business, she opens up more opportunity to earn income, and by repairing their vehicle she will solve the problem of transportation. She wishes to expand her business to a city in the east of the country, because she has identified that there are possibilities there.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, and use the rest to repair the vehicle that she and her husband have.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
