texts.es: Edy, de 44 años es una mujer soltera. Cuidó sola de sus 7 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Saños Grande.  Ella confía en su asociación, pues lleva mucho tiempo trabajando con ellos. Gracias a su apoyo, pudo obtener muchas cosas para mejorar su condición de vida. Su principal actividad económica se centra en el cuidado de sus animales como: pollos y cuyes, los cuales comercializa a buen precio, posee un número considerable de ellos, cada día los dedica a mejorar la raza y poder brindarles buen alimento. Además de aprovechar el tiempo que pasa en su casa, para fabricar leña, que vende a las saunas, quienes ya la conocen y constantemente le realizan pedidos. Trabaja sin descanso, pues tiene que mantener por si sola a sus hijos. Por eso en las mañanas trabaja en una casa, limpiando. “Soy reina de la limpieza”, comenta muy alegre. Todos estos trabajos la mantienen ocupada y con el frente de progresar para de esa manera ver a sus hijos desarrollados. Este es el crédito número dieciocho con MFP, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Además le gusta pertenecer a su asociación, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Edy de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de eternit y madera para construir los galpones para animales.
texts.en: Edy, who is forty-four years old, is a single woman. She has raised her seven children by herself. Currently, she lives with four of them in her own home, which is located in the town of Saños Grande. She trusts her group because she has worked for a long time with its members. Thanks to its support, she has been able to obtain many things to improve her quality of life. Her main economic activity is raising animals, i.e. chicken and guinea pigs, which she sells at a good price. She owns a considerable number of them, and every day she works to improve her stock and be able to provide them with good feed. Additionally, she benefits from the time she spends at home by cutting firewood, which she sells to saunas. The sauna owners know her and continually order firewood from her. She works tirelessly since she has to provide for her children herself. As a result, she cleans a house in the mornings. “I’m the cleaning queen,” she says happily. All of these jobs keep her busy and help her to get ahead so she can see her children develop. This is her eighteenth loan with MFP. She is happy because she has the capital she needs to improve her business and, as a result, her quality of life. Additionally, she likes belonging to her group because its members are hard-working and caring people. Edy will invest the loan she is requesting by purchasing Eternit cement and wood to build a shed for her animals.

loans.use: To purchase Eternit cement and wood.

loans.name: Astley

texts.en:
Astley is 39 years old, married, and the father of three children. For the last 3 years, he has earned a living by selling goods at his retail shop. He earns a monthly profit of KES 18,000. 

Astley was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our credit officers and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 to buy additional business stock such as soft drinks, cooking flour, cooking oil and so on to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he may provide a good and stable life for his family.

loans.use: to buy additional business stock such as soft drinks, cooking flour, cooking oil and so on to sell to his customer.

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Sumac Puririsun” en la ciudad del Cusco por lo tanto actualmente se encuentra en el VIII ciclo,  el banco comunal está conformado por catorce mujeres que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; venta de tamales, venta de comestibles, venta de mazamorra morado, venta de jugo, venta de comida y venta de artesanía. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país.

Presentación forma parte del banco comunal, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos de la cuales uno es independiente y los demás todavía depende de la socia. Presentación nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos y con ayuda de su pareja. Su actividad económica de Presentación es el lavado de ropa a mano a domicilio y también a la limpieza de casas. En esta oportunidad Presentación requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la educación de sus hijos. 

Las socias en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Sumac Puririsun” communal bank several years ago in the city of Cusco so they are now in their 8th cycle.  The communal bank is composed of 14 hardworking, enterprising women who always seek opportunities to get ahead with their daily efforts in order to provide their children with better futures.  The economic activities of the members are varied.  For example:  tamale sales, food sales, ‘mazmorra morada’ [purple corn based sweet] sales, juice sales, food sales and crafts sales.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in Cusco department in the very heart of the ancient Inca city.  It’s noted for being a tourism zone and for its archaeological centers and for its historical city center, its scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern part of the country.

Presentación is part of the communal bank.  She’s married and her beautiful relationship has produced three children one of which is independent and the others are still dependent on her.  Presentación tells us very proudly that with help from her spouse she’s moving her children ahead. 

Her economic activity is washing clothes by hand at her customers’ homes and also cleaning houses.  On this occasion, Presentación needs a personal use loan, that is, to pay for her children’s schooling.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their various installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational expenses.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es: Virgilia de 52 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella empezó este negocio por dos motivos el de que su esposo la abandono y no tenia como darle a sus hijos los alimentos cuando eran pequeños . haci que decidió vender productos químicos para aumentar su situación económica. Le va bien en su negocio . ella lo realiza en su casa esa es su dificultad por que es químico fuerte y lo respira. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su hija . a futuro anhela tener un local fuera de su casa .  con el préstamo comprara ( productos quimicos).
texts.en: Fifty-two-year-old Virgilia lives in a suburb of Guayaquil.  She started this business for two reasons: her husband abandoned her and she had no way of providing food for her children when they were young.  So, she decided to sell chemical products to improve her economic situation.  Her business is going well.  She does her work at home, which is difficult because the chemicals are strong and she breathes them.  She works every day with the help of her daughter.  In the future, she hopes to have a shop outside of her home.  With this loan she will buy chemical products.

loans.use: to buy chemical products

loans.name: Amelia Del Pilar

texts.es: Amelia de 31 años vive (libertad ecuador ). Ella aprendió a través de su esposo  porque el desde muy joven lo hacia . ella se dedica a la panadería y a una tienda que tiene su esposo la ayuda a hacer el pan . es casada tiene hijos . trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo con mucho amor y ganas . a futuro anhela tener un vehiculo y tener una buena casa .con el préstamo comprara (cestos para produccion de pan )
texts.en: Amelia, 31, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  She learned from her husband because he’s done it since he was very young.  She has a bakery and a store.  Her husband helps her make the bread.  She’s married and hast children.  She works every day with help from her husband with much love and effort.  In the future she’d like to own a vehicle and a good house.  She will use the loan to buy baskets for bread production.

loans.use: to buy baskets.

loans.name: Florvia Belinda

texts.es: Florvia de 56 años vive (suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella comenzó vendiendo bisuterías . luego decidió ponerse un bazar de apoco . es casada tiene una hija el esposo se dedica a ser cerrajero. Ella trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su hija . la dificultad es la delincuencia.a futuro anhela tener tienda Y un bazar grande . con el préstamo comprara ( cuadernos, papeleria, plumas).
texts.en: Florvia, 56, lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil.  She started out selling notions but then decided to open a variety store with a little.  She’s married and has a daughter.  Her husband is a locksmith.  She works every day with help from her daughter.  The difficulty is crime.  In the future she’d like to have a store and a large variety store.  She will use the loan to buy notebooks, stationery items and pens.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, stationery items and pens.

loans.name: Maribel Aurora

texts.es: Maribel de 37 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella decidió entrar al negocio de la venta de comida por que le gustaria iniciar un nuevo negocio. Peor por ahora ella para financiarce tiene su negocio vende de productos y cosmeticos Avon . trabaja todos los días sola . a futuro ella anhela tener una mejor vida para ella y su familia . con el préstamo comprara ( arroz, aceite, frutas, granos, granes para el necgoio de comida).
texts.en: Maribel, 37, lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil.  She decided to go into food sales because she’d like to start a new business.  For now, in order to earn income she sells Avon products.  She works alone every day.  In the future she’d like to have a better life for her and her family.  She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, fruit and bulk items for her food business.

loans.use: to buy oil, fruit and grains.

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.es: Santa de 54 años vive ( paraíso Guayaquil ). Ella empeso su negocio con una mini tienda . luego de 2 años cerro la tienda por motivo de salud. Ahora que ya esta mejor empezó pero con un mini bazar le va bien pero quiere mejorar. A futuro ella anhela ver a su hija graduada y arreglar su casa trabaja todos los días sola. Con el presatmo comprara ( utiles escolares, papeleria ).
texts.en: Santa, 54, lives in Paraíso, Guayaquil.  She started her business with a minimart but closed it alter two years because of health.  Now that she’s better she started with a minis tore that does well but she wants to improve.  In the futures she wants to see her daughter graduate and to fix up her house.  She works by herself every day.  She will use the loan to buy school supplies and stationery items.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and stationery items.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Iii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Nueva Generación III” en la ciudad del Cusco por lo tanto actualmente se encuentra en el XIX ciclo,  el banco comunal está conformado por siete mujeres y siete varones que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; venta de desayunos, venta de comida, venta de productos de ferretería, venta de zapatos, venta de comestibles, venta de pollo a la brasa y venta de chompas.
 
Elva forma parte del banco comunal, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos de la cuales los dos todavía depende de la socia. Elva nos cuenta con mucho orgullo que está sacando adelante a sus hijos y con ayuda de su pareja. Elva es docente y hace 5 años que ejerce su profesión pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de zapatos. En esta oportunidad Elva requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país.

(El socio que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografia pidio permiso para no estar presente el dia de la reunion)
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Nueva Generación III Communal Bank several years ago in the city of Cusco.  As such, they are currently in their nineteenth loan cycle.  This communal bank is made up of seven women and seven men who are working and enterprising people who are constantly seeking out opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, to provide their children with a better future.  Some examples of the female members' businesses are the following: selling breakfast, selling prepared food, selling iron products, selling shoes, selling food, selling barbecued chicken, and selling sweaters.

Elva is part of the communal bank.  She is married and her beautiful relationship has produced two children, who are still her dependents.  Elva proudly tells us that she is getting her children ahead with the help of her spouse.  Elva is a teacher and she has been practicing her profession for five years, but in her free time she sells shoes.  At the moment, Elva needs this loan to buy shoes.
 
All of the members are thankful for the opportunity offered to them and they promise to make their respective loan payments on time.  Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco, right in the heart of the ancient city of the Inca.  It is known for being a tourist attraction because of its archeological centers, its historic downtown area, its landscapes, its history, and for being a charming city in the southern region of the country.

(The member shown in the lower part of the photo asked permission to be absent on the day of this meeting.)

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Grupo Salidario La Corteza 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña  Rosa  es una Señora muy  emprendedora  y responsable, junto  a  ella  vive  su  2 hijas  y 7 nietos  que  le  apoyan  en  cada  unas    de los  compromisos  que   obtiene,  ella  vive  en  el  triunfo  Choluteca.
Doña Rosa su negocio  es  pulpería  en  su casa de  habitación, tiene  bastante  demanda ya que hace mas de 15 años  tiene  este  tipo  de  negocio. El  préstamo lo invertirá en  la  compra  de  maíz, arroz, café, azúcar, carne, pollo, pan, pastillas y otros productos de consumo básico, de esta manera incrementar  sus  ventas con el abastecimiento de productos para su negocio. Con  el préstamo  espera satisfacer la demanda de  sus clientes y a si tener  mejores  ingresos  para  tener  una  mejor  forma  de  vida.
Doña Rosa una  metas es que en los  próximos  años  tener  un negocio más  fuerte  y así  ayudar a mas a sus hijas y a sus nietos.
 
Doña  Erika  se dedica  a la  fábrica y venta  de  tortillas  en  su casa  de  habitación.
Don  Félix se dedica a su negocio propio pulpería  en  su casa de habitación a tiempo completo.

Choluteca,   Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Rosa is an entrepreneurial woman and also very responsible, her 2 daughters and 7 grandchildren live with her and help her with every single comittment she has.  She lives in marvelous Choluteca.

Rosa runs a grocery store out of her home and is in great demand since she has been in this kind of business for 15 years.  She would invest the loan towards the purchase of: corn, rice, coffee, sugar, beef, chicken, bread, pills, and other basic goods, this way she could increase sales with a well stocked business.  With the loan she hopes to meet her customer demand and this way have improved revenue for a better quality of life.
Rosa's goal is to have a stronger business within the next few years and this way be able to help her children and grandchildren.

Erika makes and sells tortillas from her home.
Felix works full time from his home running a grocery shop.

Choluteca, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, coffee, sugar, beef, chicken, bread, pills, and other basic goods for the business.

loans.name: Grupo Amigos En Accion Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Verónica, tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su compañero de hogar, Su actividad principal es la venta de mercadería como ropa de varón y de mujer desde hace más de 13 años,  Doña Verónica esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, faldas, calcetas, zapatos, sandalias y otros productos para la buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio de manera ambulante le facilita la venta de su mercadería al llegar personalmente hasta sus clientes,
Doña Veronica con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar, y así tener una mejor calidad de vida,
Doña Veronica trabaja  muy duro uno de sus sueños es tener un local propio en su casa.
Elda se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de medicinas, ropa de  varón  y de mujer, ella cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio, tiene 2 hijos.
El Señor Máximo López, se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería en general (pulpería) el tiene  5 años de experiencia en el manejo del mismo, tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, ya que al dedicarse a la agricultura en temporada ella se hace cargo de la pulpería.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Verónica is 47 years old and lives with her partner.  Her main source of income for over 13 years has been selling merchandise, such as men's and women's clothing.  Verónica is asking for support to buy products such as pants, tops, undergarments, skirts, socks, shoes, sandals, and other products to better serve her customers.  As she carries out her business on foot, it is easier for her to sell her merchandise because she personally visits her customers.

The help from the loan she has requested will contribute to her having a better business and, consequently, making more income to cover her household expenses.  This will allow her to have a better quality of life.

Verónica works very hard.  One of her dreams is to have her own store in her home.

Elda is a salesperson for a living.  Her primary source of income is selling medicine and men's and women's clothing.  She has four years of experience running her business.  She has two children.

Máximo López is a salesperson for a living and his main source of income is selling foodstuffs in general (small grocery store).  He has five years of experience running this business.  He has three children and he has the support of his wife, as when the farming season comes, she runs the grocery store.


Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - March 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, undergarments, skirts, socks, shoes, sandals, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Richar Edgardo

texts.es: Richar tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijas las cuales son  estudiantes y dependientes de sus padres,  su esposa se dedica a la venta de materiales de costura. Richar desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y ropa de cama, y también hace trabajos de construcción, el trabaja en conjunto con su esposa y sus hijas, son personas luchadoras, honestas y responsables. El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para la compra de dos fardos de ropa para cameras y edredones con estilos que estén a la moda para así poder llamar la atención de sus clientes y de este modo pueda aumentar sus ventas. La vida económica de Richar ha cambiado grandemente desde que recibe el apoyo de los préstamos de FAMA, aunque en estos momentos las ventas han bajado bastante. Su meta es mejorar el negocio y enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar de forma honesta, ya que es la mejor herencia que puede dejarles. Este es el primer crédito que solicita Richar en FAMA y espera pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Richar is 31 years old, married and has 3 children who are in school and still dependent on their parents.  His wife works selling sewing materials and for 2 years now, Richar has been selling used clothing and bed linen as well as working construction jobs.  He works alongside his wife and daughters, they are  perseverant, honest and responsible people.  
The loan solicited is needed to purchase 2 bales of clothing and bedroom linen that are in style and this way attract the attention of his clients and increase his sales.  Richar's economic lifestyle has changed in a big way since he began receiving loan assistance from FAMA, even though sales have currently dropped.  
His goal is to improve the business and to teach his kids to earn an honest living since this is the best he can leave them.  This is his first loan with FAMA and he hopes to make punctual payments.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing and bed linen

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, además de muy jovial y sociable.  Es conviviente con Demetrio quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 2 hijos Demetrio de 17 años y Anny de 10 años de edad  a los que quiere mucho. Juntos están habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Tomasa es la compra y venta de calaminas de segundo uso, además de nuevas, para eso compra su producto en ocasiones, trasladando su mercancía a su domicilio, saliendo a ofrecer a zonas alejadas, y vendiendo muchas veces a crédito para luego realizar el cobro diario. También vende calaminas nuevas que compra de las distribuidoras ya que muchas le piden de esa calidad. También cuenta con un empleo de medio tiempo realizando labores de limpieza en una empresa privada. Lleva realizando ésta actividad hace más de  1 año  y contando  con  el apoyo de su pareja en sus ratos libres en la atención y administración del negocio. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene por las construcciones de viviendas en los conos de la ciudad donde vende su producto.
Con las ganancias que obtiene apoya a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, además de estar agradecida por sus hijos a quien está logrando brindar una mejor calidad de vida y una adecuada educación. Por lo contrario, no le gusta el caminar a diario para realizar las cobranzas ya que esto le genera un cansancio físico por la lejanía de las zonas donde ofrece su producto. Por otro lado, debido a esos inconvenientes tiene planes de abrir una bodega de abarrotes en un puesto del mercado de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, Esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de mantenerse con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete en cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de calaminas nuevas y de segundo uso al por mayor y así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 42, and an enterprising, hard-working woman, who is also very cheerful and out-going. She lives with her partner Demetrio who works in construction, and is the father of her two children: Demetrio, 17 and Anny, 10, whom she loves very much. They are living together comfortably in their own house.  

Tomasa buys and sells corrugated roofing, both second-hand, as well as new.  For this, she buys her product from time to time, transporting her merchandise to her home, and going out to sell it in outlying areas, many times selling on credit, and then doing daily collections. She also sells new corrugated roofing that she buys from distributors, as many ask her for that quality. She also has a half-time job doing cleaning work at a private company. 

She has been doing this work for more than a year, and in his spare time her partner helps her serve customers and run the business. She considers her business quite profitable, because of the earnings it provides her, and the demand she has because of home construction in the outer districts of the city where she sells her product.

With the earnings she gets, she helps her partner with the household expenses.  She is also grateful because she is managing to offer her children a better quality of living and an adequate education. On the other hand, the daily walking she does to do her collections makes her physically tired because of the remoteness of the areas where she sells her product. Moreover, due to these drawbacks, she has plans to open a small grocery store in a stall in the city market. 

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution. She is very happy to know that she will have a loan, as this way she will sure of supporting herself through her business. Therefore she promises to make her installment payments, as with the previous loans. With the amount of 4,000 nuevos soles applied for, she will purchase new and second-hand corrugated roofing at wholesale, and this way have better profit margins.

loans.use: To buy new and second-hand corrugated roofing.

loans.name: Santos Candelario

texts.es:
El señor Santos tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres están pequeños y tiene que trabajar mucho para sostener a su familia. Él tiene 32 años de experiencia en la agricultura y lo desempeña desde que era un niño de 12 años de edad, ya que es un legado que le dejo su padre.

Actualmente trabaja como corralero ganando $50 dólares semanales y en la temporada de la agricultura se dedica a cultivar el maíz y los frijoles, lo que considera que es lo principal y de lo que gana como corralero compra otros productos  para mejorar un poco la alimentación de sus hijos.

Para comprar los insumos que necesita para realizar su trabajo, se traslada desde su hogar durante veinte minutos en autobús, al regreso tiene que trasladar los insumos en su espalda hasta su casa. Santos esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 5 sacos de abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de $100 dólares por el alquiler de la tierra donde cultivara el maíz y el fríjol.

De esta manera podrá cultivar lo principal y le ayudara para que no le falte el sustento diario a su familia. Él desea comprar una bicicleta porque la que tiene ya no le sirve y es la que utiliza como medio de transporte para ir de su casa a su lugar de trabajo, ya que recorre treinta minutos y también la bicicleta le sirve para trasladarse a comprar algunos alimentos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old. He is married, and has four children, three of whom are small. He has to  work hard to support his family. He has 32 years of farming experience, and has been doing this work since he was a 12-year-old child, as it is a legacy his father left him.

Currently he works as ranch hand, earning $50 a week. In the farming season, he grows corn and beans, which he considers to be his main livelihood, and from what he earns as a ranch hand, he buys other products to slightly improve his children's diet.

To buy the supplies he needs for this work, he travels 20 minutes from home by bus. When he returns, he has to transport the supplies on his back to his house. Santos is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy five sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay $100 to rent the land where he will grow corn and beans.

This way he will be able to grow his main crop, and this will help him so that he doesn't lack what he needs to support his family. He wishes to buy a bicyce because the one he has doesn't work anymore; it is what he uses as a means of transport for going from his house to his place of work, as this takes him 30 minutes. He also uses the bicycle as transportation to buy some food items for his family.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, and pay $100 to rent the land where he will grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Yei. She sells charcoal and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean est Pasteur. Il est marié,  âgé de 57 ans et a 10 enfants dont le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 4 ans. Quatre de ses enfants vont à l'école. Aucune autre personne n'est en sa charge.
Il est devenu client d'ACB en 2012 et le cycle actuel est le premier pour lui. Il a utilisé le crédit qu'il a bénéficié dans la réhabilitation de sa maison d'habitation. Ceci permettra à sa famille de vivre dans un endroit propre. Il a une stratégie de construire d'autres maisons dans le futur. Ces masions seront mises en location et les loyers y provenant lui aideront de payer le minerval et les frais médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mister Jean is a pastor. He is married, 57 years old, and has ten children aged four to thirty. Four of his children attend school. He doesn't have any other dependents.
He became an ACB customer in 2012; the current loan cycle is his first. He will use his loan to rehabilitate the house in which he lives. This will allow his family to leave in a more proper place. He has a strategy of building other houses in the future. These houses will be rented, with the resulting rents helping him to cover his children's school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his house.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод молодой парень 23 лет . Он недавно женился, детей пока нет. Он торгует на рынке мебелью. Дилшод сам изготавливает различные мебели по заказу клиентов. Опыт в изготовлении мебели почти 5 лет. Раньше он больше строил мебель, но от привоза и продажи  кухонных гарнитуров и спальни он получает больше прибыли. Поэтому он планирует на полученный кредит  привезти мебель с России и других стран.
texts.en: Dilshod is a young man at 23 years old.  He recently married, but there are no children yet.  He sells furniture at the market.  Dilshod manufactures various types of furniture to his clients' orders.  He has five years experience in manufacturing furniture.  He used to do this more, but he earns a bigger profit by importing and selling kitchen sets and beds.  For this reason, he is planning to use the loan to import furniture from Russia and other countries.

loans.use: to import furniture

loans.name: Grupo Nuevo Jutiapa Group

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge tiene 53 años de edad, tiene una 2 hijas, Su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería) desde hace más de 3 años, el cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, Don Jorge y su familia viven al oriente de Honduras.
Don Jorge esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos como azúcar, manteca, jabón, refrescos, carnes, papel higiénico maíz frijoles y otros productos de consumo para darles una mejor buena atención de sus clientes, ya que al tener su negocio ubicado en la calle principal y cerca de una iglesia la afluencia de clientes es bastante, con el apoyo solicitado del préstamo que reciba Don Jorge le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudar a sus hijas con sus estudios,
Don Jorge uno de sus sueños es tener una de las mejores pulperías de la zona.
El Señor Juan se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería (pulpería) el cuenta con 3 años de experiencia. Negocio que opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “JUAN”
El Señor Danilo se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de abarroteria (pulpería), y el destazo de reses sus negocios se llaman pulpería “BANESSA” y carnicería

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras Marzo 2012
texts.en:
Jorge is 53, and has two daughters.  His main livelihood is selling groceries at his general store. He has been doing for more than three years, and has help from his wife. Jorge and his family live in eastern Honduras.

Jorge is applying for the loan to buy products such as sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans, and other household products, in order to give better service to his customers. By having his business located on the main street, and near a church, there is quite a flow of customers. 

With the help of the the loan he gets, Jorge will invest in having a better business. This way he will earn more income, in order to provide his family with a better quality of life and help his children with their schooling. One of Jorge's dreams is to have one of the better general stores in the area.

Juan is a businessman; his main activity is selling groceries at his general store, and he has three years of experience in this. He runs his business under the name "Juan's General Store."

Danilo is also a businessman; his main activity is a grocery store and butchering cattle. His businesses are called "Bannessa General Store," and "Danlí Butcher Shop."

loans.use: To buy sugar, lard, soap, soft drinks, meats, toilet paper, corn, beans, and other household products for his business.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда удачно закончив свой очередной кредит решила подать повторную заявку на получение займа.Мавчуду можно поздравить с рождением внука. Она очень рада , что её дочь без проблем родила долгожданного сынулю.После выписки дочери,Мавчуда со спокойной душой начала продолжать свою торговлю, и получив кредит она планирует съездить за товаром в Истаравшан и завезти  весенне- летний ассортимент товаров.
texts.en: Mavchuda successfully repaid her latest loan and has decided to make another loan request.  Mavchuda can be congratulated on the birth of a grandson.  She is very glad that her daughter had no problems giving birth to her long-awaited baby boy.  Once her daughter was released from the hospital, Mavchuda resumed her clothing sales with a calm heart.  After receiving her loan, she is planning to travel to Istaravshan to buy a spring and summer assortment of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of clothing

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru: Аброр  перспективный трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат  имеет трех детей. Семья дружная. Жена и дети помогают по бизнесу. Он занимается откормом скота. На данный момент у него имеется 5 голов крупного рогатого скота. Также он имеет автомашину марки «МУССО» на которой предоставляет услуги такси. У него свои постоянные пассажиры. Он хочет получить займ для увеличения поголовья скота и закупа запчастей для автомашины. Он надеется на ваше милосердие и поддержку. Спасибо!
texts.en: Abror is a hard working man who shows a lot of promise.  He is married and has three children.  His is a tight-knit family.  His wife and children help him with the business:  fattening cattle for sale.  At the present time he has five head of cattle.  He also has a Musso automobile with which he provides taxi services.  He has his own regular clients.  He wants to take out a loan to increase the size of his herd of cattle and to buy spare parts for the car.  He is relying on your benevolence and support.  Thank you!

loans.use: to buy spare parts and cattle

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and from Njabini. She is married to John and they have three children who are all in school.

Josephine has been a farmer for the past ten years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and manure to put on her farm. She hopes that the farm will do well and that she will have much harvest.

She hopes to diversify into cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mavzunakhon

texts.ru: Мавзунахон трудолюбивая и добрая женщина, которая замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Мавзунахон имеет богатый опыт в сфере торговли. Более 15 лет она занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды и обуви. Сначала она продавала нижнее белье, и последнее время перешла на продажу мужской одежды. Она является собственником бизнеса и не имеет долгов перед поставщиками. Имеет хорошую репутацию среди знакомых и конкурентов. Мавзунахон запрашивает займ для дополнительного закупа мужской одежды и обуви, точнее красовок, шлепок, а также детских и подростковых красовок, футболок и шорт.
texts.en: Mavzunakhon is a hardworking and decent woman.  She is married and the loving mother of two children.  Mavzunakhon has a wealth of experience in the field of sales.  For over 15 years, she has been selling men's clothes and shoes.  When she started she also sold underclothes, but lately she has gone over to selling men's clothes.  She is the proprietor of her business and she is not in debt with any of her suppliers.  She has a good reputation among her acquaintances and competitors.  Mavzunakhon is requesting a loan for an additional purchase of men's clothing and shoes.  More precisely, a purchase of tennis shoes and flip-flops, as well as children's and teens' tennis shoes, t-shirts, and shorts.

loans.use: to buy men’s clothes and shoes

loans.name: Bessy Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Bessy tiene 27 años de edad, ella vive junto a su compañero de hogar con el que han procreado 2 hijos, una niña de 2 años y un varoncito de 10 meses. El esposo de Bessy se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles), Bessy es una joven luchadora se dedica a su negocio y en los tiempos libres se dedica al estudio. Bessy y su familia viven en el departamento de el Paraíso, Honduras.
Bessy se dedica a la venta de ropa americana actividad la cual realiza desde hace un año, sus ventas las realiza en su casa de habitación y también sale a vender en diferentes barrios y colonias donde ella tiene su clientela a quienes se ha sabido ganar por la atención y precios que les ofrece y sobre todo la buena calidad de producto que les vende.
Bessy el préstamo lo esta solicitando para comprar 3 paquetes de ropa americana con pantalones, camisas, calzonetas, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños, aumentando sus ventas Bessy cuales mejorara sus ganancias y la situación económica.
Bessy, tiene planes y metas futuras de instalar su negocio grande en el centro de la ciudad, también tener su casa propia y finalizar sus estudios universitarios para tener una mejor economía y un mejor bienestar para sus hijos 

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo de 2012
texts.en:
Bessy is 27 years old. She lives with her spouse with whom she has 2 children, a 2 year old daughter and a 10 month old boy. Bessy's husband works in agriculture (he plants corn and beans). Bessy is a young woman who is a fighter and who works at her business and in her free time studies. Bessy and her family live in the department of El Paraíso, Honduras.

Bessy sells American clothes, an activity she has done for a year. She sells from her house and she also goes out to sell in different neighborhoods where she has customers whom she was able to attract with the service and prices she offers, and above all with the quality of product she sells.

Bessy is asking for the loan to buy 3 packages of American clothes with pants, shirts, shorts, blouses and children's clothes to increase her sales and her earnings and financial situation. 

Bess has plans and plans for the future to set up her business in the center of town as well as to own her own house and finish college to have better finances and more wellbeing for her children. 

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Marzo de 2012

loans.use: to buy 3 packages of American clothes with pants, shirts, shorts, blouses and children's clothes for her business.

loans.name: Renacer Del Cerro Del Guayabal  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Renacer Del Cerro De Guayabal se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio Guayabal del  Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional.
 
Este es un grupo de 13 socias que hace 4 meses decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha sido de gran ayuda ya que han podido aumentar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Margarita Cuz, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 8 hijos, 7 de ellos mayores de edad y una chica de 14 años que estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que uno ya está comprometido. El esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella para ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa  y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas  diarias,  deja sus productos a crédito ya que si no es así no vende y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bien. Gracias a esto ella puede pagar los estudios de  su hija.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Este es el segundo ciclo al igual que la mayoría en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.

Su sueño es ver que su hija sea una profesional ya que por eso ella lucha para darle una buena educación.
texts.en:
The Renacer Del Cerro communal bank  of Guayabal meets every two weeks in Guayabal, Cantón Montecristi. This place is known its rich pre-colonial culture and its artisanal crafts, recognized nationally and internationally.   
 
This is a group of 13 members who decided to get together 4 months ago and form this communal bank. It has been a great help, since they have been able to grow their small businesses. They work in different activities such as sales, services, selling food and more.  

One of the members of this group is Margarita Cuz. She is 55 years old, married and has 8 children. Seven of them are grown and a 14 year old girl goes to high school. All of her children live in her home, although one is engaged. Her husband is a merchant.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she sells clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume and women's accesories). She sells door to door, working three days a week for two to three hours a day. She sells her products on credit since if she doesn't she doesn't sell, and collects every week. She has been doing this activity for more that 4 years and it is going well for her. Thanks to this, she was able to to pay for her daughter's schooling.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes. This is her second loan, like it is for most of the members of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are quick. 

Her dream is to see her daughter earn a professinal degree and that is why she fights day to day to give her a good education.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cometics and clothes.

loans.name: Yntymak - 2 Group

texts.ru:
Группа  «Ынтымак-2»  была создана 1 февраля    2011 года, в селе Мазарсуу. Лидер группы - Кундуз, 28 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей.  В 1998 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Кундуз начала бизнес в животноводстве, использовав для этого сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодня в хозяйстве Кундуз  имеется 35 овец, 10 ягнят, 4 козы и 4 лошади. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кундуз обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец - молодняка. Доходы Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья. 
Баринкан 53 года, замужем, имеет 4 сына.  Баринкан на протяжении 37 лет занимается животноводством и  полеводством.  В своем хозяйстве Баринкан  имеет 1 корову, 10 овец  и 10 коз, а также ежегодно обрабатывает 1 га земли, где выращивает кукурузу и картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Баринкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец - молодняка.


Турганбу 58 лет, вдова, имеет 7  детей.  Турганбу на протяжении 39 лет занимается животноводством и  полеводством.  В своем хозяйстве Баринкан  имеет 12 овец, 2  коз и 3 лошади, а также ежегодно обрабатывает 1,60 га земли, где выращивает кукурузу. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турганбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец - молодняка.
texts.en:
The group Yntymak - 2 was founded on February 1, 2011 in the village of Mazarsuu.  The group's leader is Kunduz.  She is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  In search of income for her family, she began her business in animal husbandry in 1998 with 10,000 som (KGS).  Today, her herd numbers 35 sheep, 10 lambs, 4 goats, and 4 horses.  With the goal of further developing her business, Kunduz applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves and young sheep.  Kunduz is planning to use the income in further increasing the size of her herd.  

Barinkan is 53 years old, married, and has four sons.  Barinkan has been in animal husbandry and farming for 37 years.  On her farm, she has one cow, 10 sheep, and 10 goats.  Every year she cultivates 1 ha of land where she grows corn and potatoes.  With the goal of further developing her business, Barikan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves and young sheep.  

Turganbu is 58 years old, a widow, and has 7 children.  Turganbu has been in animal husbandry and farming for 39 years.  On her farm, she has 12 sheep, 2 goats, 3 horses.  She also cultivates 1.6 ha of land, where she grows corn.  With the goal of further developing her business, Turganbu applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves and young sheep.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход женат и ответственный отец троих детей. Он занимается купле- продажей мужской одежды. Она начал свой бизнес в 1997 году  собственными денежными средствами. Его магазин находится на центральном рынке города. Фарход имеет постоянных клиентов и хочет расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью Фарход запрашивает займ для покупки модных сезонных товаров для развития своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Farhod is married and a responsible father of three children. He buys and sells men's clothing. He started his business in 1997 with his own money. His store is located on the central market of the town. Farhod has regular customers and wants to expand his business. He is asking for a loan with this purpose to buy fashionable and seasonal clothing to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Marianita De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Marianita, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que ya están comprometidos. Su esposo trabaja en una universidad de la localidad.
 
Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa y madre de familia también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y joyas de fantasía, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres de a cuatro días por semana, ya sea en las tardes o en las mañanas y cuando sus clientes necesitan algo también la visitan en su hogar,  deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente o en quincena como prefieran sus clientes, lo que es mercadería lo va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil o a Quito dependiendo de lo que necesite, lleva 20 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  joyas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ir mejorando su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The community bank Women of Progress meets every two weeks in the citadel of San Cristóbal in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and hospitable place which is know as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.
In this place, we met Marianita. She is 63 years old, married, and has four grown children, two of whom still live with her even though they are engaged. Her husband works in the local university.
In addition to being a good housekeeper and mother, she also works selling all types of clothes and custom jewelry. She sells door to door and works three or four days a week, either in the afternoons or in the mornings. When her customers need something, she will also make special trips to their homes. She sells on credit and her customers pay her monthly or every two weeks, whichever they prefer. When she needs merchandise, she goes to Guayaquil or to Quito, depending on what she needs. She has been running this business for 20 years and it is going very well. 
She is going to use this loan to buy more pants, blouses, t-shirts, and jewelry. She has been in the community bank since it started and she likes it because the loans have enabled her to improve her business. 
Her dream is to have a car to help with her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and jewelry.

loans.name: Mayra Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este Lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de seis  y cuatro años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela y el menor este año empieza el jardín de infantes. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella con junto con su esposo tienen un negocio de compra y venta de arroz, su forma de venta es por quintales o por saquillos de 25, 15 y 10 libras, dependiendo de lo que sus clientes necesiten, ellos tienen un  local en su casa en el cual realizan sus ventas. Trabajan todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00,  compran el arroz en una piladora en la provincia del Guayas, lugar al que viajan cada quince días para surtirse de estos productos, llevan  más de 7 años con este negocio y  les ha ido muy bien ya que tienen clientes que todos los meses le compran ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas o cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz ya que luego escasea y se pone más caro para lo cual van a invertir todo su capital y tener bastante en reserva. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya más de dos años  y le gusta porque los créditos son mucha ayuda.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Women of Progress meet every two weeks in the citadel of San Cristóbal in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and hospitable place which is know as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.
In this place, we met Mayra. She is 30 years old and has a common-law husband and two children who are 6 and 4 years old. The oldest is in school and the little one starts kindergarten this year. Her husband is in commerce.
She and her husband have a business buying and selling rice. They sell in units called a quintile or in sacks of 25, 15, or 10 pounds, depending on what the customers need. They have a store in their house where they sell their rice. They work every day from 7:00am until 7:00pm. They buy the rice from the Guayas province, and they go there every two weeks to stock-up. The have been running this business for more than 7 years and they have done very well as they have customers who buy from them every month because they sell on credit and customers can pay each week or every two weeks.
This loan will be used to buy rice because later on it will be scarce and will become more expensive so they are going to invest their capital so they have plenty in reserve. She has been a member of the community bank for more than two years and she likes it because the loans are a great help.
Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда разведенная женщина, которая на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она очень трудолюбивая и старательная женщина, имеет свадебный салон «Орхидея». В 2007 году она открыла свой бизнес, именно по прокату свадебных платьев и услуг парикмахера собственными денежными средствами. Она предоставляет услуги парикмахера, наращивания ногтей  и другие виды макияжа. Мавчуда хотела бы получить займ для покупки модных новых платьев с целью обновления гардероба свадебных платьев. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a divorced woman who is raising three children.  She is very a hardworking and diligent woman who owns a bridal salon called Orkhideya (Orchid). With her own money, she opened her business in 2007 renting out wedding dresses and styling hair.  She offers hairdressing, nail extensions, and applies other kinds of makeup.  Mavjuda would like to receive a loan to purchase dresses in the newest styles to update her stock of wedding dresses.  She is relying on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses

loans.name: Khayala

texts.ru:
Khayala uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov no ranshe ona razvodila ovec. Ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Khayala uje 29 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona ochen drujelubniy i dobriy chelovek. Khayala yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi.

Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Khayala has been raising livestock for the past 7 years. Currently, she keeps cows, but was raising sheep previously. Khayala needs 2000 AZN to buy additional cattle in order to expand and develop her business.

Khayala is 29 year old, she is married and has 2 children. She is a very kind and friendly person. Khayala is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli, currently residing in the Fuzuli region together with her husband and children.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buys cows

loans.name: 27 De Julio  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen  cada quince días las 17 socias y  1 socio  del Banco Comunal 27 de Julio. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura y al comercio en general. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo en el mismo ya que se han visto muy beneficiados con los créditos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Nelly, tiene 43 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen 4 hijos, tres mayores y el menor de 12 años el cual vive con ellos y estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en el campo.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a  su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, edredones, toldos y varias cosas más,  decidió empezar con este negocio debido a que los gastos eran muchos y su marido ganaba muy poco en el campo y con esto no les alcanzaba, es así como ella y con lo poco que tenia decidió entrar al mundo del comercio, ya son varios años que realiza sus recorridos ya que ella sale tres a  cuatro días por semana a ofrecer sus productos mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra por semana.  Ahora con la ayuda de los créditos las cosas han mejorado mucho.

Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones, toldos entre otras cosas.

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo pequeño y que este tenga una buena educación.

La foto pequeña es de cuatro socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Cady, parish of Colon, and city of Portoviejo, the 18 members (17 women and 1 man) of the 27 de Julio Communal Bank meet twice a month. The members work in diverse activities such as agriculture and trade in general. They brought their strengths together in order to be able to access the benefits provided by the Fundación Espoir. This is their third cycle in the communal bank and they hope to continue for a long time, the same as now, as they have greatly benefited by the loans.

One of the members of this group is Nelly. She is 43 years old, has a common-law relationship from which she has 4 children, 3 adult age and 1 younger who is 12 years and who lives with them and is a school student. Her husband works in the fields.

She is a good mother and housewife who in order to help her husband with the household expenses works as a merchant, selling sheets, comforters, canvas awnings and various other items. She decided to begin this business because the expenses were high and her husband earned very little in the fields which was not enough, and this is how she, with very little, decided to enter the world of commerce. It has already been some years that she has been making her journeys, three or four days a week, to offer her products, leaving them on credit, and collecting payment on a weekly basis. Now with the help of the loans, things have improved greatly.

This loan is in order to buy sheets, comforters, and canvas awnings among other things.

Her dream is to give her best to her little daughter and that she has a good education.

The little photo is of four of the members who could not be there when the photo of the group was taken.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters, canvas awnings, etc.

loans.name: Nera Anabel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señoirita Nera, tiene 19 años  de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Estudia odontología en una universidad local. Este es su tercer ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha ayudado para salir adelante tanto en su negocio como en sus estudios.

Ella además de ser una gran estudiante también se dedica al comercio para tener  para los gastos sus estudios, ella vende ropa en general y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres a cuatro días por semana, aunque también les vende a sus compañeras en su universidad, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, la mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil ya que allá consigue mejor variedad y más barato, lleva más de 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas.
 
Su sueño es terminar su especialidad.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Women of Progress meet every two weeks in the citadel of San Cristóbel in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and hospitable place that is know as the City of the Royal Tamarinds. 
In this place, we met Nera. She is 19 years old and single and lives wither her parents. She is studying dentistry in the local university. This is her third loan cycle with the community bank and she likes it because the loans have helped her to be successful both in her business and in her studies. 
In addition to being a good student, she also runs a business so that she can pay for her studies. She sells clothes door to door and works three or four days a week. However she also sells to her friends at the university. She sells on credit and customers pay her monthly. When she needs merchandise she goes to Guayaquil as there is a greater variety there and it is cheaper. She has been doing this for 4 years and is doing well. 
She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and other clothes.
Her dream is to finish her degree.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and other clothes.

loans.name: Asif

texts.ru:
Asif 43 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On i yego bolshaya semya jivut v Fuzuli regione. Asif uje 9 let kak rabotayet masnikom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi kupit maso dlya pereprodaji. On takje nujdayetsya v uvelicheniye mesachnix doxodov dlya soderjaniya svoyey mnogodetnoy semyi. Asif yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. 

Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Asif is 43 years old, he is married and has 4 children. He and his large family live in the Fuzuli region. For nine years, Asif has been working as a butcher. Currently, he needs 1600 AZN to purchase meat for resale. He also needs to increase his monthly income to support his many children. 

Asif is an internally displaced person (IPD) from the city of Fuzuli.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru: Каримджон трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. Несмотря на свои молодые годы Каримджон занимается одновременно  двумя видами бизнеса: земледелием и скотоводством. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и купле- продажей скота. Более 3-х лет он в этом бизнесе и хорошо справляется с этим. Раньше Каримджон никогда не кредитовался, но его опыт в деятельности подсказал ему, что есть возможность расширить бизнес за счет привлечения дополнительного капитала. Поэтому он запрашивает займ для покупки скота и нужных средств для земледелия.
texts.en: Karimjon is a hardworking and conscientious family man.  Notwithstanding his young age, Karimjon is simultaneously engaged in two kinds of business:  farming and animal husbandry.  He grows food crops and also buys and sells cattle.  He has been in this business for over three years and he manages it well.  He has never taken out a loan, but his business experience is telling him that there is an opportunity to expand his business by mobilizing additional capital.  For this reason he is requesting a loan for the purchase of cattle and tools necessary for farming.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven en su casa además de un nieto de 8 años que es como suyo y que estudia en escuela.

Ella para ganar el sustento diario se dedica al comercio, desde hace mas de 7 años se dedica a la venta de dulces, mangos, grosellas  en funditas con sal, ciertas golosinas y bocadillos elaborados, ella se desplaza en un triciclo por los lugares donde se reúnen las personas,  sobre todo a la salida de ciertas escuelas y colegios ya que estos son sus mejores clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 17h30, su nieto le ayuda en su labor cuando él está desocupado.
  
Este crédito es para comprar mangos, golosinas, bocadillos y varios productos que ella vende. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya más de cuatro años es la presidenta del grupo  y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Women of Progress meet every two weeks in the citadel of San Cristóbal in the city of Portoviejo, which is a beautiful and hospitable place that is know as The City of the Royal Tamarinds. 
In this place, we met Bertha. She is 49 years old and is a single mother with 4 grown-up children, two of whom live with her along with her 8 year old grandson who she treats as her own child and who is in school. 
To earn a living, she is in business. For more than 7 years she has been selling candy, mangoes, dried fruit snacks, some sodas, and sandwiches. She sells from a tricycle cart which she rides to the places where people gather, particularly at the entrance to certain schools as the students are her best customers. She works every day from 6:30am until 5:30pm. Her grandson helps her with her work when he is free.
She will use this loan to buy mangoes, candy, sandwiches, and other goods that she sells. She has been in the community bank for more than 4 years and is the president of the group. She likes it because of the help and benefits that she gets from the bank.
Her dream is that she and her family will have good health.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, snacks, sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.ru:
Sabina zamujem, imeyet 2 prekrasnix detey. Deti Sabini uchatsya uje v shkole. Ona i yeyo semya jivut v Fuzuli regione. Sabina 37 let. Eto molodaya devushka uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey  produktov i imeyet svoy magazin. Ona zanimayetsya prodajey raznix pishevix i bitovix produktov. Ona nujdayetsya v 1600 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomnesheniye svoyego magazina i kolichestvo polok dlya razmesheniya bolshe tovarov dlya prodaji. Sabina yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda. 


Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Sabina is married and has two  lovely children. Her children attend school. Sabina and her family live in the Fuzuli Region. Sabina is 37 years old. This young woman has been selling groceries for five years, and keeps her own store. She sells various food and household items. She needs 1600 AZN in order to expand her facility and add more shelves, so that she could display more goods for sale. Sabine is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to expend her store.

loans.name: Venus Marianita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Venus, tiene 65 años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace varios años, los cuatro que tiene ya son  mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos aun vive con ella con su familia.

Ella para ganar el sustento diario desde hace varios años puso un  local en su casa en donde prepara y vende hamburguesas, papas fritas y otras comidas rápidas, además de jugos, batidos, colas entre  otras bebidas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 18h00 hasta las 23h00,  con ella trabaja una persona  a la cual ella le paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo. Gracias a este trabajo ella pudo salir adelante sola con sus hijos y darles una buena educación.

Este crédito es para comprar carne, pan, papas, sodas, frutas y otros víveres  para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en todo este tiempo que está en el grupo.

 Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Women of Progress meet every two weeks in the citadel of San Cristóbal in the city of Portoviejo, which is a beautiful and hospitable place that is know as The City of the Royal Tamarinds. 
In this place, we met Venus. She is 65 years old and is separated from her husband, with whom she had 5 children (but one of them died some time ago.) The 4 other children are grown-up, and one of her sons and his family live with her. 
To earn a living, she has been running a store from her home for some years. She makes and sells hamburgers and fries and other fast fruit as well as juices, shakes, sodas, and other soft drinks. She works every day from 6:00pm until 11:00pm. She pays one person to work with her. Thanks to this job, she has been able to bring up her children alone and give them a good education.
She will use this loan to buy meat, bread, potatoes, fruits, and other supplies for making her products. She has been with the community bank since it started and she likes it because of the help she has been given in all this time with the group.
Her dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, potatoes, sodas, fruits, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy five dozens of hair gel and 12 dozens of hair extensions

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 30 years-old, married, and has three children.  All the children are still in school. 

Agnes heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Fifonsi Rachelle S.

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Fifonsi Rachelle S. est une distributrice de pagnes, d'assiettes et de produits cosmétiques dans son quartier et ses environs. Elle vit maritalement avec deux enfants à charge. Dans le but d'élargir son activité et de bien satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite et obtient un concours auprès de Finadev afin de maximiser son revenu supplémantaire et de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Fifonsi Rachelle S., 33 years old, sells traditional “pagnes” fabric, tableware and cosmetic products in her neighborhood and surrounding areas. She is married and has two dependent children. In the goal of enlarging her business and meeting customer demand, she requested and obtained support from Finadev in order to maximize her supplementary income and contribute to the family budget.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of traditional "pagnes" fabric, 15 plates and 10  various cosmetic products.

loans.name: Tuili

texts.ru: Туйли трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин. Он женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Имеет арендованную землю, где выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, арахис и люцерну. Туйли также занимается откормом и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. В бизнесе помогают дети и жена. Туйли запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и оплаты труда рабочих.
texts.en: Tuili is hard-working and a good family man. He is married and is raising five children. His wife takes care of the household. For over 10 years, Tuili has been growing and selling crops. He leases land on which he grows wheat, corn, peanuts and alfalfa. Tuili also raises and sells large and small livestock. His wife and children help with the business. Tuili is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and to pay labourers for their work.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay his workers

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She sells fish and has been in business for one year. She is 35 years-old, married and has three children.  All of her children are still in school. 

Charity heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 26 year-old unmarried man.  He is a pig farmer. He has been in the business for one year now and gets a monthly income of two thousand shillings.

This will be Stephen’s first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase animal feed.  With the profit that he will get he wants to further his studies. 

In the future, he wants to rear more pigs and supply to a processing industry.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is a 30 year-old farmer. He lives in Agarakadzor village with his parents. Tigran works at the local stone dressing factory. Besides, he is also involved in cattle breeding. Tigran's parents have been running the farm for many years, Tigran always helped them with agriculture and now he does the main work himself. 

Tigran plans to increase the number of livestock, which is currently four. With the help of this loan he will purchase three more cows. 

Tigran plans to get married and dreams of having his own big family. Development of agriculture is vital for Tigran to make his dream come true and ensure a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cows

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, chemicals,weaves, hair shampoos and conditioners.

loans.name: Elizabeth Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo conocido como La Ciudad De Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad bella y hospitalaria, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elizabeth, tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, su marido se dedica a la albañilería. Ella estudia los últimos semestres de medicina en la Universidad.

Ella además de atender su hogar y sus estudios también se dedica al comercio,  vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también les vende a  sus compañeras en su Universidad. Deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, se inicio en este negocio hace más de tres  años y le ha ido muy bien ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de tres  años y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe de la institución.

Sus metas son terminar su carrera y tener su casa propia pues vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en:
In the San Cristobal neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful and welcoming place known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the communal bank "Damas de Progreso" meets every 15 days.

Here we meet Elizabeth, 20, who is in a common-law marriage and has a 3 year-old child.  Her husband works in construction.  She is in her last semesters of studying medicine at the university.

In addition to tending to her home and her studies, Elizabeth has a business selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works every day, and she sells her products door-to-door, and she also sells to her fellow students at the university.  She sells on credit and collects every 15 days.  She started this business more than 3 years ago, and it has gone very well because she has a very good customer base. 

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics.  Elizabeth has been with her communal bank for more than 3 years, and she likes it because of the help and benefits she receives from the institution.

Her goals are to finish her degree and have her own home, as she now lives in her parent's home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics

loans.name: Dukore Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Madame Félicité, agricultrice des pommes de terre fait partie du groupe DUKORE TWITEZIMBERE (qui veut dire travaillons pour notre développement). ELle a 45 ans, mariée et a 7 enfants dont le plus âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Six de ses enfants vont à l'école et aucune autre personne n'est en sa charge. Son niveau d'éducation est 8 ans de l'école primaire.
Elle est devenue cliente d'ACB en 2010 et le cycle actuel est le 2ème pour elle. Elle a bien remboursé le crédit antérieur. Le crédit actuel lui a permit d'acheter 200 kgs des pommes de terre, 1 sac d'angrais chimiques, etc. Trop de soleil ou trop de pluie sont les seuls éléments qui peuvent faire que ce crédit soit remboursé difficilement.Pour accroître son activité agricole, Madame Felicité a une stratégie d'augmenter la surface qu'elle cultive en achetant d'autres champs. Ceci sera possible grâce aux crédits qu'elle va solliciter dans le futur. Elle a l'ambition, après avoir augmenté la surface, de diversifier les produits qu'elle cultive. Pour la famille, elle va continuer d'éduquer ses enfants et va construire une maison residentielle pour sa famille. A part de l'activité financée, Madame Félicité fait l'élévage des chèvres.
texts.en:
Félicité is a potato farmer and a member of the DUKORE TWITEZIMBERE group (which means "let's work for our development").  She is 45 years old, married, and has seven children, whose ages range between 21 and 5 years.  Six of her children are in school, and she has no other dependent.  Her education level is 8 years of elementary education.
